title: Lovely view, easy to find bar
comment: It is such a quirky and vibrant place, we had a lot of fun with my girlfriend, however, we had to wait a bit of time to be serviced, but that's not a problem, at least at the end everybody was happy! Will pay you another visit! Thank you for making our date night memorable!

title: very rude front of house
comment: I visited 2020 Aug Bank hol and as they only accepted walk ins took my chance.  When I arrived I politely asked if there were any tables for my girlfriend and I. I was told no and there could be a wait of up too 30 mins.  We decided to wait in the designated line. We were the only people waiting in the line at that time.  A couple then arrived and decided to ask the front of house staff if she had a table for two also. To our surprise they were told there was a table and taken through?  The front of staff was a short female with black hair in a short / shoulder length haircut.  There could have been a hint of racism as we were of Asian oritenstion and she was letting a lot of other people from white/ Caucasian backgrounds through without hesitation.

title: Best spot in Shoreditch
comment: Visited with friends for drinks and dinner on the terrace last night and had an incredible evening! The steak and calamari dishes were exquisite! The Passion Mint cocktail is definitely worth coming back for too. Couldn't have asked for a better time - the staff made it a very special evening for us.

title: Nice food but outrageous 15% tip
comment: Visited here with my wife for our 5th wedding anniversary. Upon arrival it was made very clear to us (kind of strayed into the aggressive category) that we had our table for 2 hours and it would be needed back at the set time. Fully understand the need to turn tables, but really think that message could have been communicated in a much better way. Anyway, the food and cocktails were great and decent portion sizes too. Service was alright but nothing spectacular so then rather offended to receive the bill with a 15% tip on it. Obviously understand tips are optional (and a tip was still left) but then the waiting staff seemed hugely offended that the full 15% wasn't paid. I struggle with paying 15% in the USA but for that you do usually get excellent service so feel having their standard service charge at 15% is pretty offensive

title: Incredibly rude staff. Don’t bother wasting your time!
comment: We arrived as a walk in as the roof terrace does not accept bookings but were told by the very rude and arrogant woman at the entrance there was no space.  You work in hospitality - be accommodating and polite to your customers!!  Most definitely will not be returning not worth wasting your time or money here. There are many more beautiful rooftop bars in London with friendly accommodating staff. The boundary is most definitely not one of them. Don’t bother, stay away!!!

title: This bar was great, although
comment: This bar was great, has great views of the surrounding area. We managed to see this gorgeous sunset. Stayed for 2 hours. Service was good and staff were nice. Although it’s on the expensive side I spent £45 on meal and 3 drinks. You’re paying for the view today. Portion sizes are small and not wide range.Would recommend for drinks not food

title: Disappointed..
comment: Had been really looking forward to this meal, however: Service- waited outside for a bit in the rain by a sign that said 'wait here to be seated'. When no one came we went inside and were greeted by a disinterested maitre d. Whilst waiting to meet our server the ladies next to us were asked to leave to make space for the next seating of customers. Eventually got to order, later heard new couple sitting next to us to hurry up and order as the kitchen was shutting. Whilst eating, a server cleared our side plates, moving the chips and sauce onto the table.. not sure why? Ambience - loud, hot, humid. Cramped together tables. Covid - no distancing between tables at all. Given heat and humidity this would be a high risk transmission environment. Couldn't see the QR sign in code. Food - starter was unpleasant. Ate less than half as it was so greasy. Waiter clearly clocked id not eaten it and then didn't ask what I thought and just cleared the plates. Steak was nice. Chicken and chorizo skewers were good. Chips could have literally come from the freezer at Iceland. Aioli was lovely. Cocktails were okay. Cost- I would happily have paid 30-40 for this meal.however, it cost just shy of 100 pounds. No printed bill given and when presented on an ipad the added service charge was not highlighted (15%). Upon booking a room at the boundary, we were advised that we would receive a glass of champagne each with a main meal. This was not offered to us, and we did not ask as by this point we wanted to leave.  I would never return here.

title: Great rooftop restaurant
comment: Return visit for me and my loved ones - definitely one of our favourites during Covid. Safe spacious dining area and outdoor covered terrace seating perfect for cocktails! Friendly team who have always looked after us. We miss the seafood platter though :(

title: Nice rooftop bar, very friendly
comment: Nice rooftop bar, very friendly and speedy service. Good bottle of Malbec, not massively expensive to what you may imagine for a Rooftop bar in the area

title: Deceptive customer service ; professionally uncommitted
comment: Disappointed by the insensitive and casual attitude to customer service.. Booking was made on site, face to face a week before the event.... Found out at the venue, on the day of the event, that the booked Birthday lunch had to be cancelled because the receptionist made a wrong assumption about the attendees...  Imagine if it was a booking for a wedding!... Note: cannot comment on food and beverages as didn't had a chance to experience...

title: A perfect evening
comment: A perfect evening.... we were staying at the hotel - and didn’t want a full meal. We were greeted upon arrival by a very friendly chap who took us to our table, brought us a complimentary glass of champagne and took our order without having to make a note of it - which was impressive!  You really feel like you are on holiday! With the view of the area, mood lighting, music ... great atmosphere...  The food we chose - charcuterie, a bit of seafood, buratina and chips! Yum yum  Oh and a cheeky glass of rose ...  Lovely .. perfectly lovely

title: Totally Unwelcoming !
comment: Last night my friends and I went for drinks and dinner. We were greeted with the advice that our booking was for 2 hours only. We were early so wanted to have a drink before eating , there was some reluctance for us to sit outside on the terrace despite it being virtually empty. After dinner we had to negotiate to be able to return to the terrace despite the fact that there were plenty of empty seats ! Overall the venue is quite nice but nothing special , the food was average and the hospitality was unwelcoming . As there are so many wonderful places to go in London this will not be my choice again !

title: Let down by the service but great food
comment: Let down by the service but great food and overall good ambience, would return to give it another chance

title: What a wonderful place
comment: Came here two times and I plan to come back. Great view and great atmosphere. When you make a reservation, ask for a place in the sofa's if you're not planning to eat

title: Cocktails on the roof
comment: We enjoyed cocktails with a view, pricey but very nice. Staff very friendly. Busy had to queue for 30 mins due to covid-19 precautions.

title: Anniversary dinner
comment: My girlfriend took me here on our anniversary last Saturday and we had the loveliest dinner ! The food and drinks were great not to mention the amazing atmosphere. The staff were so friendly and accommodating especially our Cristina was absolutely brilliant and made the experience extra special ,we LL be back for sure

title: Amazing Location and Service
comment: I went with friends for the first time on this roof top located on the best Shoreditch 's part !! Service and drinks were pretty good i would raccomend to everybody this fancy place, i have to be thankful certainly to Christina the waitress for help me out to choose with her advices our drinks and let us feel welcome!

title: Relaxing Sunday morning on the terrace.
comment: Cozy atmosphere, great service and delicious food. Wish I could stay longer to try the cocktails.

title: Wonderful covid safe venue
comment: Lovey dinner with my friend for her first dinner out post-lockdown. Great social distancing measures and the staff made her feel very safe. Luckily the sun was out so it made the night perfect. Cocktails and dishes were scrumptious!

title: After a very good experience
comment: After a very good experience dining in the sister kitchen downstairs at the Albion decided to try the Boundary on Saturday night , have to say the way it was well worth the short wait we had due to the safety precautions they had put into place due to Covid , all the staff were friendly and welcoming while at the same time ensuring safe practices, the menu choice is small but varied and there’s something for everyone, food was really good and well presented, our waiters serving us were really friendly and helpful, would highly recommend.

title: Really fantastic evening
comment: Really fantastic evening. Sadly the weather took a turn but it wouldn't be a UK summer without a bit of rain!! The glass covered area we had dinner in was cosy and spaced really well given covid. Service was speedy and not too imposing. Really friendly team and the food was tops. We managed to get a spot under one of the umbrellas after dinner for cocktails. Great shoreditch spot!

title: Excellent meal
comment: We had a wonderful evening with my family at Boundary roof top. Cocktails were superb and calamari probably the best I’ve had. Definitely recommend trying the fondue! Overall it was beautifully hosted meal.

title:
Nice but poor
Food
comment: I usually come here as my works meetings in shoreditch area, it is a nice place afterwork to enjoy a cocktail in the middle of the urban neighbourhood. The only thing is the quality of food, would need an improvement on that and than will Be perfect.

title: Gorgeous place
comment: A few days ago I celebrated my birthday with my friends in Boundary Rooftop. The Restaurant has a fantastic view, fancy cocktails. I would like to say many thanks for the staff They made my day gorgeous. I strongly can recoment this place to anyone. I believe in the summer is the best spot. Many thanks for Boundary Rooftop team.

title: The rooftop bar has seriously gone downhill
comment: Not sure what has happened to this place but it seems to have lost its way. We visited as a large group on Friday evening and did not have a great experience.  To begin with we entered through the lobby only to be unnecessarily held waiting whilst someone phoned up to confirm if there was room for us. A few minutes of waiting we are told there is and that we can go up. What we found when we came out the lift was maybe two or three tables of people, no more. There were more staff than customers so you’d think they’d hurry you up and in rather than waiting downstairs in a small cramped lobby.  We were ‘served’ (if you can call it that) by a lady who seemed to strongly resent being there. Rather than walking around the table menus were thrown on one side and when the drinks came they were passed to one person to pass around the entire table. With the unfriendly attitude we received we did not stay for more than one drink.  It was only when we decided to leave did our unfriendly waitress smile and actually express some pleasantries.  Should not have paid the service charge. For a place like this where you can sit outside with heaters on a cool February night in central Shoreditch for it to be almost empty on a Friday evening others must also not be happy with something. A shame.  It’s easy to lose regular customers but tricky to get them back once they’ve gone.

title: It’s all about the service
comment: I can’t for the life of me remember the name of our waiter but he was soo much fun. Really lovely buzzy place . We did sit inside as it was January but the view was still great . Food reasonably priced wine not so cheap though. Good standard of food here would love to go back in the summer !

title: Perfect weekend afternoon spot
comment: Visited the rooftop on a Saturday afternoon and it was perfect. The sunshine was out and the space and vibe was super chilled. Chairs were comfy and drinks were spot on would definitely recommend to others!

title: Good views over London but poor service and average food
comment: I sent an email to the Boundary about my experience, and didn't get a reply. I visited The Boundary rooftop bar on Sunday 17th November. I arrived with a friend and had two drinks each on the terrace which was great, we had booked a table for lunch for 2pm. The cocktails were great, but the waiter was slow in taking our order. The service wasn’t at all attentive, and was not up to the standard of somewhere charging the prices they do. In the restaurant, we had to call over twice to order our food from a waiter.   I mistakenly spilled some of the bottle of red wine we had ordered on the table (I knocked my water glass against it – an accident). A member of staff came over and offered to get us two glasses of the wine – we had assumed this would have been on the house. When we asked for the bill (which was approx £200) we noticed the two glasses of wine were on the bill, we queried this with the waiter who checked with a manager and were abruptly told we were to be charged for the wine.  We paid our bill in full – but took off the optional service charge because of this and the general bad service. I normally would have complained in person, but as I was on a date I didn’t want to get into it yesterday. I emailed this to The Boundary on Monday - and didn't get a response. Bad service like this really lets the place down, and clearly by not even responding to my email, management here don't care.

title: Could of been 4
comment: Visited for my friends birthday. Beautiful place and was looking forward to the seafood... which was sold out. This was just one thing of a long list that wasn’t available on a already small menu. Gutted. Ordered chorizo and octopus skewers. After trying my friends calamari to start I was excited because the calamari was good! Unfortunately the octopus was so small I couldn’t really taste it. Then.... we all ordered the apple dessert to be told a few minutes later they had none. Having a really small dessert menu left me not really liking the other choices so was left disappointed. The service was good but I believe if I had of had the meal I wanted it would been higher. But travelling all the way to London to go here I was left very let down.

title: Fab times....
comment: Great place and great staff. Thanks Iman for looking after us so well! Thanks for also re locating us and outside when the sun came out! Alastair

title: Rude Manager with some anger issues! Avoid this place.
comment: Avoid this place! The manager has some anger issues. An honest mistake of calling him to order starters, to which he responded "Do I look like a f***ing waiter to you?" (Great job of undermining job of your own team!). When we showed our annoyance and questioned his aggressive and rude behaviour, he asked us to leave the place and says "Aggressive means different to him" while clenching his fist, to that we replied “are you f***ing crazy?”, this was the only time we acted outside respectable language and we decided to end the conversation as he again acts disrespectfully by telling the bouncer “dump them out”. Not going to this place ever again and surprise to see such behaviour. I guess they have forgot that they are in a hospitality industry and not hostility.

title: Perfect spot for a birthday meal
comment: Had a great evening celebrating my 21st in the Orangery. The food was a selection of sharing platters and seasonal. Great sunset views and atmosphere while service was friendly. Made for a very enjoyable celebration. Thank you!

title: Rude staff
comment: I visited this restaurant and rooftop bar for my sons birthday and all I can say is don’t bother ! The food was very average to say the least and my daughter didn’t even receive a meal although they very kindly said the would remove it from the bill big deal ! but no other compensation or apology was given just that the waitress had forgotten .We then moved outside and some others friends arrived I then had the unique experience of being shouted at by an extremely rude and officious young man as I stood up to greet them .He yelled across the table that no one was allowed to stand on the terrace and I must sit down ,which I had intended to do anyway without his unpleasant remarks .This was a family occasion for a special birthday but unfortunately the whole experience left me feeling extremely disappointed and I honestly wish we had never booked it .

title: Cristal
comment: We came as a group of 4, we had a fantastic afternoon on the amazing roof terrace. We got looked after by Iman who couldn’t have done any more for us. Loved the cote be boeuf and he advised us on some great wine. Loved it

title: Nice view but service could be better
comment: Nice view and nice location too. The wine list as the menu are average price so that’s ok but the waitress (nice girl) couldn’t open the bottle as the bottle opener was damaged and even worst they wanted to serve us wine inside ridiculous glasses you can’t even find inside a bloody pub: need to improve on that!!!!! Despite this the location just looks great and there another very rare pro: as you go to the loo you have a hand cream and as well a very fancy hand soap with salty minerals inside do deep clean your hands. The thing is that you can see a huge effort but the place gets lost on the basis. You can definitely improve guys. Let’s go, you can make it!!!!!

title: Best Saturday night!
comment: Umbrellas, heaters and blankets to keep you warm & dry outside. Tasty drinks and excellent service from the waiter. Love the rooftop!

title: Perfect to catch the last rays of the summer
comment: Wonderful relaxed setting with comfortable seating and views of Shoreditch and the city. We had tea and deserts which were beautifully executed and full of flavour. The price tag is higher and worth the experience. Definitely worth booking fir lunch and dinner.

title: Great views! Great atmosphere !
comment: This is our third time at the rooftop bar, the views are great and the drinks reasonably priced. The atmosphere is very laid back with nice background music, the staff were very good. Bianca on the reservation desk downstairs couldn’t have been more helpful and accommodating, big thanks to her for being smiley energetic and friendly.

title: Mouse in the bar
comment: Arrived for drinks and maybe dinner, was seated on the rooftop. Second drink in and spot a mouse running around the rooftop bar. Decided not to stay for dinner (!!) and left promptly. No acknowledgement from staff that this was odd, no discount offered. Really not great at a cocktail bar - won’t be back in a hurry!

title: Unique
comment: On a warm evening, it’s delightful. They have blankets for when it gets chilly and a good drinks menu. A lovely place to while away a few hours.

title: Excellent rooftop restauarant with superb seafood
comment: The food was great , the atmosphere was a bit noisy with all that funky music being boomed out early evening but this was a great place for seafood and a view of contemporary Shoreditch

title: Fantastic Saturday Evening With Friends
comment: We returned to Boundary on a Saturday eve for dinner and drinks, and although it was a bit windy, we couldn't actually feel the cold as they have heathers and blankets. Gabriel, who seemed to be in charge, looked after ourselves; the staff was very polite and their food and drinks were top of the class. Will definitely be returning!

title: Started off well !.......
comment: A lovely bar with cool tunes , however ....  Get there early , book a table , and be very prepared to share any small amount of space you may think you have to yourself.  The operation is ran with military precision by a team of staff who seize on any opportunity to squeeze more people in.  The food is lovely, the oysters were superb, however the fact you are squeezed in really does ruin any experience you may well have had here.  In addition if you are a non smoker not the best place as you are so tightly packed in chances you will be near smokers ! Having said that we would return.

title: Horrendous service - Arrogant staff
comment: Recently booked a table for my sisters 28th birthday. No one acknowledge us from the get go, and when they did they were rude. Almost every waitress spoke to us terribly. I wanted to discreetly ask for a birthday cake to come out, and the waitress was blunt and lacked any enthusiasm, made me repeat myself to the point of ruining the surprise of the cake as my sister had enough time to leave and come back to see everything, but nothing was seriously done, and the cake wasnt even taken it was a complete embarrassment. Then i was abruptly told i would have to pay a 20 pound fee (for the cake that i paid for and bought with me) just to be brought out - on top of the surprise being ruined even though they knew that the booking was for a birthday they had no intention of helping at all. Staff were so unprofessional and acted as if they weren't working but were casually walking around joking with one another while we were constantly waiting to be seen to. On top of having a birthday meal ruined, they were unapologetic and disgustingly impolite. It got so bad that we didnt even order food. We paid for our drinks and left. I seriously wouldnt bother spending any money here, especially as the prices arent exactly the cheapest. Definitely dont go for a special occasion!!!

title: A special place with sumptuous food and superb service in the sunshine
comment: How do I do justice to this wonderful rooftop venue? Let me first sing the praises of Emmanuel and Iman who were our champions - from the moment we arrived for lunch in the restaurant and throughout the relaxing afternoon on the rooftop sofas, they guided us through the menu, encouraged us to try the Italicus based Sassy Bergamotto cocktail, which is not only sublime, but quite honestly summer sunshine in a glass - and they were on hand to meet all our needs! We were initially a group of 3 and enjoyed the octopus & chorizo skewers and the plateau de fruits de mer. After lunch we took up a relaxing prime position on a sofa on the roof top, where we we were shaded by one of the olive trees and surrounded by pots of herbs used in the cocktails. Joined by a further 2 family members we then spent the rest of the afternoon sipping cocktails in a wonderfully sunny and vibrant atmosphere. I would have happily stayed and had dinner, but I had to go to the airport for my flight!

title: Rude and entitled staff member
comment: A friend and I had been in the Shoreditch area and walked into Boundary with the hopes of being seated in the rooftop bar. We were kindly advised by the friendly desk staff that there was a wait and we would be placed on a waiting list, with a text sent once seating was available. We ended up getting the text quite soon on and proceeded to the rooftop. We were graciously welcomed and seated at an available spot. We expressed to one of the hosts that the spot we were at was hot due to the electric heaters and whether we were able to be seated elsewhere; which was not an issue. The problem began when a staff member of the name Bianca got involved and claimed that we were not able to be seated as we had moved 3 times, which was false as we’d only just arrived. She became very unreasonable and rude, not accepting any kind of explanation, where her colleague was happy to seat us elsewhere. Her attitude was disgusting and not the kind of service we are use to from previous visits. There was no excuse for her behaviour which in the end resulted in us leaving with no desire to coming back. We explained the situation once we left to the desk staff, to which we were told she was under it due to a colleague being unwell and her having to juggle a lot. That is no excuse and I will not accept that as being an opportunity to being rude to guests. Very distasteful attitude and most likely will not be coming back particularly if the likes of staff members such as Bianca. You risk losing valuable visitors if attitudes do not change.

title: Poor service, bad attitude
comment: Visited with a group for a friend’s birthday - felt like we were at school. Constantly told to sit down and despite saying children were welcome in the email, we were repeatedly hounded by the staff to remind us that children needed to leave by 5. Service was slow, rude with an air of arrogance and drinks were overpriced. A nice location but let down by the rude, inflexible staff. Table service only and a large number of our party spent a long time waiting for drinks and yet an extortionate service charge added to the bill at the end. Would not return.

title: Wonderful mean on the hottest day of the year
comment: I was slightly concerned about having booked this restaurant due to some of the mixed reviews . However, a family group of 7 of us were there on Saturday, the hottest day of the year. All the staff were lovely and very professional and the food was superb. We would visit again without hesitation.

title: Shocking service
comment: The bar itself is lovely and has great views over London.  However my friends and I had a terrible experience here last night. We had to ask over and over again to be served, as were being completely ignored by the bar staff. It took us 30 minutes to order our first drink. Despite only ordering a bottle of wine, this then didn't arrive for another half an hour, and this pattern continued all evening with us increasingly being ignored. When I got up to inquire about a lime and soda which had been forgotten in our order, when the waitress came over she accused me of lying and already drinking my drink, when she saw the empty glass from my only other order that evening! Also to charge £4.50 for a lime and soda is completely ridiculous. Unfortunately our evening was ruined by the rudeness of the service.

title: Perfect dinner with my family
comment: I had a gorgeous evening with an awesome sunset, good food and drinks. My family was very excited about this place and about that friendly staff.  I tried the seafood plateau, very fresh and big! Very good beef, cooked perfectly.  One of my cousins ​​ordered a cocktail that was not on the menu, he was surprised how well the bartender made this cocktail. All the cocktails that we ordered very tasty (old Nichol Kanu and Serendipity are perfect), I recommend this bar / restaurant if you want to go out with your family or your friends, this is the place to be: positive energy, stunning view, very clean restaurant, tasty food and great drinks!!!

title: Great service great cocktails great food !
comment: We arrived early to the rooftop to secure a table knowing that it gets busy and you can end up waiting a long time for a table. what else can you expect when it is such a beautiful place. We were looked after by Andrea who was just a delight and couldn't be more accommodating we had food on terrace some bread olives and amazing calamari and one would say to many cocktails . I thought the our bill was very good especially because you are paying for quality the 12.5% serivce charge was more than fair as it does go the staff and we happily paid it and left extra for andrea. all in all a great visit and would highly recommend to all.

title: Great view but hugely overpriced food
comment: I went here for dinner with 4 girlfriends on a Saturday night. The place is very lovely with a great terrace, nice view and pretty fairy lights. It was also very busy and atmospheric. However, the next time I come here I will not be eating. The menu is horrendously overpriced and with not a lot of choice.  We all ordered the Robata king prawns (£21) and when they arrived we each received a TINY bowl with roughly 7 prawns with a bit of sauce. Luckily we had ordered a couple of sides but these we also very expensive. I never normally complain but I was so shocked by the tiny portions that I mentioned this to the waitress and told her were we all hugely disappointed. I had expected that perhaps we'd be given a gesture of goodwill to make up for this but we received nothing. The food also took a very long time to come to the table, I know it was busy but no attempt was made to apologise for the delay.  Overall I would go back but purely for drinks and not the ridiculously overpriced and average food.

title: Amazing!!
comment: With an impressive menu, spectacular views and an exclusive atmosphere, it’s not hard to see why Boundary Rooftop is considered the best rooftop bar in London .  All the staff it’s very friendly and will go extra mile to make sure you are happy.

title: Terrible. Not worth it at all.
comment: We had a terrible dinner experience here and sadly I can’t really say anything positive. When we arrived we were shown to a table along with another party which meant there was lots of confusion about where we were sitting. We were left standing in the restaurant between tables wondering where we should sit. We then just decided to choose a table ourselves as the staff didn’t seemed bothered to show us. This was our first put off. Then whilst we were enjoying our drink the staff were sat at one of the restaurant tables having there hair played with by another staff member. I have never observed such unusual and rude behaviour from staff in a restaurant. At this point we were ready to leave but then we thought let’s give them the benefit of the doubt and see what the food is like. Sadly it was awful! We ordered a Cote de Boeuf to share with a side of grilled vegetables. The piece of meat which apparently was to share was tiny and really a portion for one, most of it was also fat! We had about 5 mouthfuls each before it was gone. For £30 per person this is certainly not enough food nor was it at a standard and quality it should have been. The grilled vegetables were awful too, they were over cooked, cold and in a small pudding bowl. We sent these back as they looked pretty horrible, I wouldn’t serve them myself to guests at home. The staff ordered us something else, chips! The chips were also disgusting. Mac Donald’s chips are better! We complained about the food and the portion sizes and the manager (after he was finished having his hair done) kindly gave us a drink on the house and a cheese plate (which was average and the crackers were from a Jacobs sharing box!). Our waitress was very pleasant but just didn’t seem to enjoy working there- I don’t blame her.  All in all the food is terrible, not cheap, and uninterested staff. The views are all it has going for it. Sadly what could be a great venue and restaurant in one of the best cities in the world, was shameful and somewhere we will never go again.

title: Fantastic Atmospher, Friendly staff
comment: A hidden garden with a great atmosphere. We would like to say extra thanks for the staff to make our day really enjoyable and relaxing and thanks for the Chef's for the tasty food.

title: I’d expect more
comment: The wait staff seemed very friendly and helpful but were instructed by their manager to ask us to move after we had been seated. The manager on shift then proceeded to patronise us when discussing the menu, telling us that if there was anything we “didn’t understand” he would be more than happy to “explain” it to us. Not only was this incredibly rude, it was also inconsistent with what was said to other customers that evening. Our whole evening seemed to be rushed by the manager, who was not helping his customers as much as he was having a non work related conversation with the head chef. As I said before, the wait staff seemed very pleasant and my only real feedback for them is that, when people are paying over £100 a head, please offer to take their coats. Saying that, most of our queries (made to multiple employees) were answered with “I’ll check for you” and I’m guessing they are not allowed to take any initiative in their role, maybe that should be reviewed.

title: Perfect for a sunny day in Shoreditch
comment: It’s not the first time that we came at Boundary and every time we are happy with the experience. Yes, i agree that pricing is a bit steep and definitely compared with other places in shoreditch but, at the same time is one of the few places where you can enjoy a nice drink during a sunny day in this side of London. I think it worth to try it but, if you go there thinking to eat and drink without spending a lot, you will definitely be disappointed. All in all, i consider it one of my favourite rooftop in east london. Just as advice, if planning to go there always try to book before because otherwise you might end up spending lot of time in the queue.

title: New menu !!!
comment: Came in to london and had to visit again to find they had changed the menu ! They did not disappoint everything from the door table and exit was just perfect the staff clearly enjoy working at such a incredible venue thanks again boundary see you soon.

title: I love this place
comment: EXCEPTIONAL FOOD AND COCKTAILS!!Lovely and efficient staff. So good that I came back again and ordered my favourite dish Duck Confit. This is the best place to enjoy the summer. Highly recommend this place. Thank you.

title: Good to impress!
comment: It has been several times now that I have visited Boundary Rooftop - not just visits with friends but also for big business dinners. I am very satisfied from the food, service, and location. If you are in Shoreditch looking for something different then by all means give it a try and you will not regret the nice views.

title: Great views and Nice Cocktails
comment: A little hard to find , as Hotel not obvious , but Rooftop Bar has a large outdoor area and pleasant interior too . Cocktails nice

title: Good cocktails, not sure about the food!
comment: So had seen this bar in time out, so when my friend works in the area it made sense to check it out. My friend booked it ( so even if your going for drinks you have to book it). It was a nice evening and they was going to originally put us inside but we insisted on sitting outside which the staff was accommodating. We had cocktails that were good but pricey.  We then wanted food to soak up the cocktails, my friend is vegetarian and the options for her was limited but she chose the cheese with tomatoes. She didn’t like it at all and did not eat it. I ordered the pouson (baby chicken), I sent it back coz it looked pink inside. The staff and manager tried to assure me that it’s cooked coz they steam it but for my personal taste my chicken has to not be pink. The staff was happy to cook it further on the grill and after that and it was then better for my taste. The staff are nice too. I would go back again for the nice drinks and staff only.

title: Thanks to the Greek manager on duty
comment: It wasn't the first time  But as always we had a great time. Thanks to the whole staff especially Alex the manager for his recommendations and professionalism. We'll be back for sure

title: Exceptional rooftop bar & terrace perfect for summer AND winter!
comment: I challenge you to find anyone who doesn't like a rooftop bar. When it's in Shoreditch, you know it's going to be popular with those in the know.  This alfresco retreat is perched about a boutique hotel and a restaurant. This means you get impressive views of the City, especially when night falls.  Naturally, this little oasis is perfect for the warm summer months. But did you now that it's just as good in the winter? You can lounge about on wicker chairs surrounded by shrubbery, blankets, heaters and a wood-burning fire to keep you warm. Keep the Boundary rooftop terrace in mind next time you're looking for drinks with your chums. It's a bit of a hidden gem that deserves your attention.

title: Food tasted good, very overpriced
comment: The food tasted good, however, very overpriced for the portion you get. A day after the bill we received a present from the restaurant saying we didn’t attent the booking, putting us on the black list of no-shows. The day after they appologized.

title: Fantastic experience with friends
comment: We had a great Friday night. Food was very delicious, great atmosphere. We will come back again and I will recommend it to friends and family.

title: Beautiful all round
comment: We booked for valentines day and was not disappointed the rooftop had been decorated beautifully with roses and petals scattered everywhere the atmosphere was so good and the staff really adhered to our every need giving us privacy but also being there exactly when we needed them the food was amazing we both tried the oysters for the first time and were both pleasantly surprised how amazing they were. we were taken down to the vault for canapes and champagne before our dinner and very much look forward to visiting there on another day to.

title: Great setting, OK food and average service
comment: Location is great and the rooftop is a lovely setting. The food was ok but it was far too expensive for what it was. Definitely a case of paying for the location and the surroundings. The service was also a little slow and the chap running the bar outside was rude and a little self important. They were more friendly in the restaurant but still slow. Fun place to go as a group but accept you will be paying over the odds.

title: Bad food poisoning
comment: I’m normally not one to do this but I’m in so much pain and now having to take time off work because I’ve contracted food poisoning from this establishment. I know it’s from When I ate at the boundary on the 30th dec because my friend, who ate with me and shared the oysters and mussels is feeling the same and it’s the only thing we ate together that day. Contaminated food, making someone sick in this day and age is horrendous but when you’re paying higher prices you never expect this. I’ll be making sure I leave this review on your Facebook page also what makes matters worse was the added a service charge of nearly £20 into the bill, which I appreciate is standard for London restaurants but considering the service wasn’t anything special I asked for it to be taken off. Much to the dismay of the waitress. It’s disgressionary for a reason. I’d never return. Might save me a trip to the doctors!

title: Drinks only
comment: This place came highly recommended, I was very disappointed came here for my 40th birthday was sent downstairs as the roof terrace was full, staff downstairs were disorganised and rude however they looked professional, we were just about to leave when we were told we could go up stairs the setting is breathtakingly stunning however the staff were rude, slow and uninterested they charged £9 for a splash of lemonade (in a white wine spritzer) and our total for 2 of the worse tasting house wines I’ve ever had was £26 it was undrinkable, the waitress also failed to bring my change, I understand people paying by cash is rare in Shoreditch however that doesn’t give the waitress the right to pocket my change!! Such a shame as the setting is bliss however the staff, service and drinks were vile would never go again nor would I recommend

title: Lovely place but a little expensive
comment: I felt a bit ripped off to be honest although I am sure that they excuse the cost with a "it's London and a rooftop". The London bit is a little iffy, it's Shoreditch and despite the volumes of people saying it's trendy, it is still a dump compared with... Well most places in the country really. The Boundary Project is very nice, I stayed in the hotel and it is quite cool . The food was expensive, I ordered chicken kebabs with Tsatsiki and it was "minimalist" if you get what I mean. It was nice, but not special. It was all a bit pricey. Chicken kebab, a small portion of chips and a bottle of wine for £55...not good. The only thing that saves it is the rooftop experience, a wonderful summers evening. The resteraunt didn't have much influence on the weather though. Walk 400 yards or so and go to Brick Lane.

title: Amazing vibe
comment: I've been yesterday evening at Boundary. We spent a great time there. They are doing all the classic cocktails and they have amazing signature cocktails. Deffinetly reccomend this place.

title: Nice rooftop but a bit overrated!
comment: Went there with a friend for cocktails and food. Impressed that we managed to turn up and they had a table free. Ordered a cocktail pitcher of pimms which was not very good, then tried to order a single cocktail and asked for drinks with no ice as we noticed some pitchers were half full of ice. We're told that all the drinks came with ice. Not good value for the price paid. Had the steak which was ok but have had better. The views were okay but nothing special. It was quite windy and nice that they gave us blankets to wrap around us. Would not go back for the prices they charge which is a shame as it is a nice setting in the summer!

title: Amazing place!
comment: We decided to go for a stroll in Shoreditch and walking on the streets we did see a quite a few people down on the entrance waiting. we decided to go and see what is all about and we found out that they are waiting to go up on the Roof Nd that they have a nice terrace up there. Chatting between us we decided to stay and try it. In my mind we did say that it cant be that popular having people waiting on the street for a table upstairs. Finally we arrive on the Roof and what I can say is that was one the best Rooftop seen in London and one of the best experience to go out. They have a beautiful terrace, good food, amazing vibe and a good crowd is going in there.

title: Wonderful cocktails
comment: Wonderful little gem, this place is heaven, a secret rooftop terrace with gorgeous decor & great cocktails.The staff are effortlessly attentive & made our evening really special. I really recommend this place.

title: Amazing experience
comment: Great view, cocktails and food. Friendly staff, relaxing atmosphere and music! Definitely coming back soon.

title: Totally Flawed
comment: Over-priced roof deck with poor food & cocktails served by minimum wage Eastern Europeans with poor language skills (not their fault) Peroni (yes Peroni!) the only beer Only thing it’s got is a view Why can’t a good venue get it right?!

title: Do not go! So rude!
comment: If you are looking for a place for a quiet drink on a roof terrace before a nice dinner and pleasant service - then you should have come here last year or build a time machine. What was a beautiful gem of a place in London where customer service met exquisite views and reasonably priced but quality food has morphed into something else entirely. Now your quiet drink on the terrace has been replaced with a ‘we don’t have any space (shrug)’. When questioned about the good old times where a reservation in the restaurant meant a perfect service and quiet drink before dinner on the terrace, it was met with ‘there is nothing we can do’.  So if you want overpriced food with a half glimpse of a view of a terrace with a side order of rudeness from a clearly under qualified ‘general manager’ with no social skills and clearly no experience of running a decent restaurant that provides not just food but a service that makes the experience worthwhile... then this is your place.  My advice - build a time machine and go back here when it was run by skilled and competent staff, or avoid at all costs.  Sad but another quality location ruined by poor customer service... I will not be returning.

title: Ahidden treasure
comment: A few days ago I celebrated my birthday with my friends in Boundary Rooftop. The Restaurant has a fantastic view, tasty food, fancy cocktails. Iwold like to say many thanks for the staff They made my day gorgeous. I strongly can recoment this place to anyone.

title: Disappointed
comment: You are paying for the view , it’s evident from the minute you arrive. Service was average to poor as was the food. Shame as it didn’t feel to be busy but they are charging a premium for basic food. There are better places to go with a view in London and better quality food

title: Big room for customer experience improvement
comment: It could be so good. But with a cooler-than-thou greeting, greasy tables, expensive menu, and a loud 'city' crowd it ends up quite unsatisfactory. There's a rude woman with an iPad 'checking you in' before you're allowed up to the terrace, I felt 12 and back in school when she chided me for heading for the lift without talking to her! Awkward start. When you've past customs control and reached the terrace it's nice enough and the food is ok. The underside of the dining tables are greasy and dirty, so if your knees touch there you'll have dirty trousers for the rest of your night. Waited ages to pay our bill. I suppose you pay for the terrace and view, but for easily better service and a wider range of food go elsewhere in Shoreditch. Would not head back to Boundary in a hurry.

title: Beautiful hidden gem
comment: What a lovely rooftop bar to sit in an while away a few hours in! Great views across all of london on a clear day. Certainly put us in a good mood! We visited on a sunny day at the weekend for early lunchtime cocktails. The bar was busy and had a good vibe... it feels quite exclusive, (and also a little bit difficult to find - my tip is to look up and try to spot the greenery!)  We ordered pitchers of cocktails rather than individual ones to stretch the budget a bit further, and ordered some almonds, olives and breads. The cocktails were lovely, as expected. The snacks were probably a bit overpriced, the breads were a little on the dry side and would have benefited from some olive oil or other dip.  I would definitely go again for drinks.

title: Not worth it
comment: We were initially told on the phone that no booking policy exists and it's first come first serve.  We arrived around 16:30 Friday afternoon and had to wait for more than half hour outside without even being allowed to see the rooftop as it was full.  We were then offered to wait at the underground bar/restaurant having a drink until a table empties. We later discovered that there was more than enough room on the rooftop with 3-4 empty tables while having waited for an hour and a half already. We asked to be transferred to the top floor and were told in a very rude and unwelcoming way that the bar is still full and the empty tables were booked despite the non-booking policy.  It was only when we asked to speak with the manager that 2 tables magically were available (coincidentally we were 2nd on the waiting list). Arriving on the top floor we found more than 5 empty tables and were given the opportunity to choose amongst all of them as none were booked after all.  Both the food and the drinks were mediocre and overpriced and considering the hassle we obviously refused to pay the 12.5% charged on our bill as discretionary tip. My recommendation to the manager would be to teach their staff and especially the hostess at the door to not lie to a customer's face and treat them in a more professional way. Not recommending it.

title: Best Rooftop in east London.
comment: I just visit recently the Boundary Rooftop and I must say the place is amazing , good music and the provencale calamari the best I had till now. It is a must to try if you are near by. Can be a wait on the door due to the popularity.

title: perfect summer day out
comment: During my visit in London we did end up going by chance in Boundary Rooftop. Such a lovely place, the way is designed you feel like you are by the sea on a very cool terrace. The seafood platter which I tried was amazing. They had a thing going with Peroni Ambra.  I tried Ambra and they told me is an aperitf drink made from chinotto fruits . Really good one.

title: unhelpful staff and disappointing view
comment: Went there with my friends. when we arrived downstairs the person 'greeting' us was very cold and unhelpful. We wanted to get a drink on the terasse before getting dinner at the table we booked. she said it wasn't possible because they were too busy. so we had drinks elsewhere. came back for our dinner. the food was not particularly good and the view disappointing. I wouldn't go back.

title: Dreadful
comment: Had so looked forward to eating here given ,the beautiful weather and the potential for a lovely view. The reality was shocking. The initial greeting from a surly, uninterested blonde girl with earpiece and frown should have been the warning signal. Yet we persisted and waited ( sweltered) in an underground bar before being eventually allowed rooftop. Our table was tin and the chairs plastic. It was grim. Food was mediocre and overpriced. The website is deceptive and all in all a huge disappointment.

title: Glacial service, uninterested staff, ludicrous pricing. Never again.
comment: Went to the rooftop bar & grill for lunch and to watch the RAF 100th birthday flypast. Ground floor entrance is small and gloomy. We were directed in a very lacklustre manner to the lift. Not a great start. Found a decent table and settled down for a pleasant lunchtime treat. Ultimately the only good thing about the experience was the flypast. The menu is ludicrously priced (£19 for a couple of chicken skewers, £39 for a middling white wine). Service was ridiculously slow, their only answer when politely asking when food may arrive was "its coming, its coming". It eventually arrived after 75 minutes (bearing also in mind we all only have an hour break from work for lunch) barely warm, no apology. It's not as if they have a complex menu, it's all straightforward stuff.   And then there is the "discretionary" 12.5% service charge. Factor that in to your pricing because they will argue against removing it, even when they give appalling service.  To top it all off, 2 out of 3 of our party fell ill within a couple of hours of eating there. A one off visit, never to be repeated. If you're not bothered about the rooftop (and why would you, the view generally isn't that great, its not high enough) there are plenty of better places to go.

title: Its a roof top with friendly staff but that's about all.
comment: Went here early on a Saturday , it was a gorgeous hot day so a roof top sounded a good idea. It had obviously been very busy as they were hurriedly cleaning tables and making things clean when we arrived .We were lucky and got a comfy sofa to sit on . I thought it was all a bit pricey and we decided not to eat there as we thought it was a tad expensive. The drinks were ok and the staff very good but the views -well where we sat there were not any really . Its a different spot to visit in this busy area but its missing something - maybe some gentle live music?

title: Not worth the price, nor hype.
comment: Sadly nothing lived up to our expectations. The customer service was well below par, as was the food. Wait for food ridiculous.  When it finally arrived the haloumi was over cooked, chips were tasteless. This is simple stuff, pretty hard to get wrong. No check back whilst we ate. Well overpriced and 12.5% service still added to our bill, even when the service was dire. Just a joke. Will not return. Only good thing is the rooftop setting.

title: Great Atmosphere
comment: I went here with my girlfriend for our first valentines together and found that it had an amazing atmosphere and great food. The view of London was lovely, an even though it was raining, they had a way to compensate yet still provide a nice atmosphere.

title: Never left a rooftop bar more sober in my life.
comment: We had a table for three booked for a Sunday lunchtime. We arrived early and were told by very rude Front of House that we couldn't sit at one of the many free tables outside as they 'expected to be very busy', even though we were told 'first come first serve' for tables outside. Didn't receive our drinks for about 15 minutes, and when our cocktail pitcher arrived it contained enough for 3 small glasses - VERY poor for £29. Long wait to order food and no drinks offered to have with our food. Food was okay, the setting and the beautiful weather we had were the real saving graces. The covered area we ate in was ridiculously hot and stuffy, so we moved ourselves outside after we finished eating - but yet again, we weren't asked if we wanted to order anymore drinks. Note to the restaurant: we would have spent a lot more at The Boundary Project if the serving staff had been more bothered to keep an eye on us. Unsurprisingly we decided against leaving the 12.5% service charge that was automatically put on our bill. We probably could have walked out without paying and no one would have noticed.

comment: We had a table for three booked for a Sunday lunchtime. Unsurprisingly we decided against leaving the 12.5% service charge that was automatically put on our bill. We probably could have walked out without paying and no one would have noticed.

title: OK - ish
comment: Visited at the end of a day up the smoke for my better half’s coming of age (plus a few years..). Had to apply for entry at the ‘reception area’ at the downstairs entrance who had to ring and ask if there were room - this was at around 3.30 on a Wednesday afternoon.  We were granted a right of passage and boarded the lift to the roof top, which we expected to be heaving. We were warmly welcomed by (presumably) the head waiter chappie who gestured for us to sit were ever we wish as there was loads of room. Very hot day and cocktails were ordered. They arrived fairly quickly (well there wasn’t that much competition). As a consensus, the cocktails were ok, but nothing to write home about. They were quite expensive for what they were and although we had the option to stay for more, felt that the Met line beckoned and had more promise of delivery. Would I return? Well, given the opportunity, no thanks

title: A MUST VISIT
comment: Where to start, this roof top is a hidden treasure. Firstly the buliding is beautiful and the outside seating area is perfect for some nibbles and for amazing summer fresh cocktails.You can try Orange Provence, Perfect storm i love it, verry good. Servce is outstanding - love the fact that all the waiters are very polite and are very easy on the eye! The food is really good i can recommend octopus and chorizo, oysters lobsters very evident they take themselves very seriously, I've visited this roof top three times in the last two years and verytime the menu has evoloved. Well done Boundary Rooftop great job.

title: Nice environment, Dissapponting diiner
comment: The oysters were very nice The rest of the dinner was not great. The platter with the dips overpriced Stale focacia. The main dish Bavette with mushrooms and onions was served cold with only one mushroom! When we’ve asked for the dessert, we were informed that the kitchen was closed. Many apologies , discount and a glass of wine did not made us happier.

title: One of the best Rooftops in London
comment: My friends and I came to the rooftop for a few drinks and aperratifes and the level of service and care the staff took towards us was excellent! Such a cute spot for instagraming and relaxind with your friends! I highly recommend it if you're looking for something to do around shoreditch on a sunny day !!!

title: Will not return
comment: We arrived with no welcome, no hello just 'What is your name?'. Sat down at our table to then wait 15 minutes before we were acknowledged, our table was uneven after asking 3 times for them to sort it it was eventually sorted. Food was basic, extremely overpriced and the staff had an attitude. Will not be returning.

title: Average at best, very expensive
comment: Nice terrace but food and drinks very overpriced and service decidedly average. Limited menu and several items off. Definitely won't be returning.

title: Really slow but very friendly service
comment: Odd that on entry the hostess ask us to wait outside the front of the building prior to going up? Even though there are chairs inside, she wasn’t particular friendly. Always a great view, and have been here before. It must of taken 15 minutes to try and get a bottle of wine, where we had to walk up and prompt and then a further 30 minutes to try and order. The waitress was very friendly and accommodating. The wine was served in odd glassware which I would place as sophisticated or correct. The food took a life time to arrive but was ok, we had the sea bass and lamb cutlets. We ordered the desert which was actually hilarious because it was a espresso cup with chocolate in it? Hardly the chocolate desert we would expect. I ordered a Irish coffee which never came and a scotch. I would come back again, but I think kitchen service is poor and I think the waiter agreed. Also they need to update their menu, as it hasn’t changed in since last year.

title: Must Go!
comment: I am a big fan of rooftop but never been to Boundary Rooftop. I was in Shoreditch yesterday so I’ve said “why not!?” as I have had this on my wish list for a wile. I was waiting a bit at the door in order to get a table but definitely worth it. Me and my friend have had a great time. Great service and high quality food. I’ll be back soon!

title: Superb Rooftop
comment: I did visit Boundary Rooftop couple of days ago. I did had the Chicken Skewers and a bottle of Rose. Great weather and really cool music. Rooftop are made to enjoy a good drink and a nice meal Food was fresh and on point.

title: Outstanding!
comment: I've been to this beautiful place a couple of days ago as it was recommended of one one of my friends. The food was really, really tasty and the staff was very friendly and charming. Such a great admosphere. Very hard to find this kind of places nowadays. Definitely highly recommend!

title: Totally disappointed, rude waitress, worst table on the place
comment: I booked a table for a date night via their website, we arrived to the place and we were attended by a rude waitress who immediately lead us to a table on the restaurant. We asked her that first we would like to have a drink outside, at this point she rolled her eyes at take us out to the worst table in the venue, she gave us a drink menu and left. We were not happy at all with the attitude neither with a table plus the menu was only for alcoholic drinks. After few minutes thinking we consider to left the place

title: Mediocre food that's overpriced
comment: Yes, the space is great; open air, couches and tables etc BUT, the food is crap. We ordered the "Mediterranean platter" which was 5 tiny cups of dips with a hunk of bread that tasted like it came out of Tesco. All this for a whopping 18 pounds!! The cheese plate arrived with 3 tiny pieces of burnt toast. Awful The drinks are overpriced too; over 10 pounds for a cocktail and no Happy Hour. This is not a restaurant at all, but a place to hang out. If you're looking for good food, go elsewhere!

title: Lovely place with nice view !
comment: We arrived in a sunny day at Boundary Rooftop.  The place was packed and the music was good. We had cocktails and food. Cocktails very tasty £12 one but hey you are on the Roof. Very well maintaned the plants looked gorgeous.  We will return.

title: 6 hours of amazing service, food and drinks!
comment: Met some friends here over the weekend and absolutely loved the service here, super attentive and quality of food and drinks is really good. Would definitely recommend to sit on the rooftop when the weather is nice in London.

title: Awful
comment: After queueing to get up to the rooftop, we were sent down to the basement restaurant bar to wait for a table. We had cocktails there which were so weak, and when flagged up were told "It's just meant to be the taste, they're supposed to taste fresh", which makes no sense. I love cocktails and these were really not great The girl on the door came down and walked past us to tell a couple on the next table, who had came after us, that their table on the rooftop was ready. I had to stop her walking past us again and asked if our table was ready as we had been waiting a little longer than the other couple. She told me "I was told you'd left", which was bizarre, but that our table was ready  We made our way to the rooftop to find they didn't have a table yet so it was a bit awkward just hovering around. Then when we were seated we were given menus and subsequently roundly ignored. We asked a boy if we could place an order and he said he'd get someone to come over. Nobody appeared so we just left  Not sure what the attitude was here but it was clear we weren't welcome. I wouldn't go back and am telling my friends to avoid

title: Dissapointing
comment: We had lunch at the Boundary yesterday. A lovely vibe and great location but sooo disappointing. It could have so much going for it but it’s like they don’t care about even wanting good reviews or custom. A ridiculous rip off. I don’t mind at all paying good money for good food but this was a joke. The alcohol was extortionate prices and we wanted to order the house rose but they said they didn’t have any left so the next one up started at £55! For Rose - really?? And we ordered 2 shared platters for starters - these were just laughable!! About 6 egg cups half filled with a few dips with a glass of raw veg - just one piece of each kind of veg - in the middle and a bit of bread. Not enough to feed a rabbit!! I don’t understand why they wouldn’t want to try and give good value for money? I can’t see people visiting this place more than the one time. Maybe it’s just a nice place to pop into for ‘one’ drink before going elsewhere for good food!

title: Relaxing evening out!
comment: I went there a couple of days ago for a quick drink before dinner with my fiancee. The setting was really unique as it feels like you are sitting in a garden. We had a passion fruit based cocktail and another with rum and prune brandy which were divine. Service was very casual and attentive which feels even more comfortable. Next time we will give a try also on the food as they have plenty of seafood options.

title: Very poor
comment: Really not good.I just name a few things: We had a reservation at 21:30 and when we came in on time the host said the kitchen was closed. I told her I had a reservation and then the kitchen was open again. She told us that remark was for walk inns, thinking we were, which is strange because there is also a host downstairs. Anyways, we sat down and wanted to order and then heard that 4 of the 6 sides were out. We wanted bread but that was out too. We ordered the bavet which was okay except for the amount of two teaspoons of bearnaise sauce. When we did not have our food yet the waitress told us if we had something more for the kitchen to order because it would be closed. We then ordered dessert of which there were only 2 of 5 left. We ordered dessert and then got our maincourse. We did see another table now receiving bread which we thought was ackward. The location on itself is nice but the food and service are very poor.

title: So Disappointed
comment: Booked an early evening meal with my two daughters, one of them having a viewing to go to at 8.00PM. Arrived just after 6.00 PM and were able to order at 6.40, explaining that one of us needed to get away by 7.30. Our food took nearly an hour to arrive. The so called sashimi grade tuna was actually so overcooked and dry that it was inedible. My lamb cutlets, while correctly cooked, smelled like they had either been cooked on a dirty grill (ie burned on food) or had been cooked on the same area as fish and tasted bitter and also were inedible. We were sitting close to the grill and the pass and it was obvious that there was a major problem in the kitchen, observing the interaction with the waiting staff. An extra 2 guys turned up later, one of whom was cracking the whip and seemed to be getting a grip on the service when we left. I've given 2* here for the food. The waiting staff, and the manager who wrote the food off our bill, were great and the location of the bar/restaurant is fab. I will go back, but the owners of this establishment must address the problem in the kitchen.

title: Attempted to take our table away, then overcharged
comment: I booked a table for the inside area in the restaurant, but then saw there was a table outside and took it with my friend (given it is first come, first served for tables outside). My friend arrived and then we tried to move to a better table, but we were told that it was reserved (despite the restaurant already saying it’s not possible to book outside), and THEN the staff tried to tell us that our original table was now void. We had to speak to the manager just to return to the original table we already sat at. We ordered a cocktail pitcher that was mostly ice. We got the bill and then were overcharged by around 50% of the total because they took our cards without showing us what we were paying. No receipts were provided. There were no redeeming qualities. The view would have been nice, but the frosted glass borders around the boundary prevented us seeing even that. Avoid.

title: Decent cocktails, pretty good atmosphere - a bit disorganised
comment: Rooftop view of Shoreditch is maybe not the greatest in London but nice atmosphere. Drinks were expensive (about £10) but pretty good.  However, the service is disorganised, at best. When we entered downstairs, the reception people said they'd have to call up and see if there was room for 4. The reply was that they'd have to call reception back. When we got upstairs, lots of space, but took a while to get menus, then took a while to get service, eventually took a while to get someone's attention to get the bill. All with 12.5% "discretionary" service charge. I wondered whether this was because the circa 60-year old average age of our group of 4 was more than double the average for the rest of the clientele, or whether they are like that with everyone.

title: Overall good experience
comment: Myself and my friend had dinner at the restaurant last weekend. We had a bit of an issue with the kitchen closing early without warning but this was quickly rectified. Would like to thank our waiter (I believe called Alexarndur) who provided us with excellent service throughout our meal and his bubbly character made us smile throughout the evening.

title: Fantastic views, good food but a bit chilly the night we were there
comment: Well worth a trip upstairs for the view. Great outdoor area with heaters or indoor restaurant. Food was good, staff friendly.

title: Fantastic rooftop
comment: Fantastic rooftop to have lunch on a sunny day. The food was delicious and fresh. Amazing view from the rooftop and excellent service. Totally recommend it, and I look forward to come back soon.

title: I’d go again but wouldn’t rush back.
comment: Good but could be better. Tasty lobster and sea food. Great casual atmosphere and the roof terrace for sunset was a treat. Disappointment at £3.50 for stale bread, not sure what made it Mediterranean? The rest was good so this should be an easy fix. We commented this to the waiter and got a shrug. Service was unpolished (from our waiter at least) - he was attentive though and we didn’t need to wait/flag him down.

title: Appalling service.
comment: Don’t come here unless you are prepared to chase for your correct food order and the menu... When it comes the food is actuallly v good but overpriced for what it is.

title: Fairly average
comment: Sad to say the reviews were fair. Take away the view and the Sunday bank holiday and you are left with something very average. Service was slow to say the least... we had a charcuterie which was tasty but doesn’t require any prep, yet it still took 45 mins. The staff made an attempt to apologise claiming it was slow, however there are max 20 tables. Half the menu wasn’t available and the bavette was fairly average... 2 hours for 2 mains. Just not great.... not a cheap meal, but really not hard to make the improvements needed. The view saved it ....

title: Friendly staff, wonderful feel, limited menu
comment: We arrived on a Monday evening early for a 7pm table - it was not busy at all so there was no problem seating us. I had expected it to get busier later in the evening but it remained very quiet all night.  This did not detract from the ambiance - it's a lovely space with all the greenery making for a really special atmosphere. Being on the roof, of course the views are good. Its not massively high and its setting might not mean a great deal to a lot of people - you cannot really see any particular sights or landmarks if that is what you are after, but it does give you a good feel of the area.  I found the menu slightly limited - seafood platters to share and oysters to start. The 'mains' are basically a choice of skewers. I tried the bavette and halloumi - both of which I found overcooked and dry for my taste, but others might disagree.  The staff were very friendly and attentive and helped us with any questions we had.  I would go again for a drink for sure - but not necessarily to eat.

title: Mr
comment: Amazing view and food with great atmosphere and cosy wood fire. Food was great and the atmosphere as well, definitely recommend it.

title: Exceptionally poor, unfriendly service.
comment: Went midweek when this place was quiet. I was stunned by the poor quality of the service. So much so that I am actually wondering whether we did something wrong and that's why the service was so frosty.  This place is quite expensive and therefore, all the more reason why you'd hope to feel welcomed. Drinks are very expensive.  Great views. Elegant design. Trendy/cool place to hang out.

title: Delicious, if a touch expensive
comment: I’ll start by saying that my 3 rating is driven solely by the amount I spent! The food was delicious (cheese fondue, anyone? Back to the 80s!) and the service was excellent - not sure why there are reviews mentioned rude staff on here - the friendliest bunch. We didn’t use the outside area as it was too cold, but I can well imagine knocking back a few gin’s in the summer here. Worth a try.

title: Friends dinner
comment: This place would almost certainly come into its own in the summer months. That said the views are great and the food also. Service was polite friendly and efficient.  We would definitely return on a summer evening.

title: Drink with a view!
comment: We visited for a cocktail on a rainy Saturday afternoon. There's an indoor section so you still feel as though you're on a rooftop, but can stay warm and dry. Great view on a sunny day. A bit of a hidden gem in Shoreditch, feels quite exclusive, trendy décor. Would definitely visit again.

title: Great atmosphere
comment: Nice atmosphere and interior but food is way too expensive for what it is. I would prefer going back just for drinks and nibbles.

title: Summer Sun, Views and Seafood
comment: Great views if you can get outdoor seating on the terrace; order a large seafood platter and enjoy with a couple bottles to Rose!

title: Best rooftop bar
comment: Love coming here. Most rooftop bars in London are posh and boring while this one has a nice Shoreditch feeling to it. Haven't had food there yet, but a glass of wine with a view is always a good option here.

title: Bad behavior from staff
comment: We had everything reunited for a great day, friends, the view, a perfect reunion after years of travelling everyone on its own. But the guy that took orders and billing was absolutely obnoxious and didn’t smile once. If we aren’t welcome or are bothering you just say it, that type of attitude killed the whole ambiance....

title: Really good find - great location
comment: Really good bar and restaurant with friendly staff and a good atmosphere for the evening - nice in winter looking across rooftops

title: Wonderful
comment: Wonderful little gem, this place is heaven, a secret rooftop terrace with gorgeous decor & great cocktails. The sit down dinner was even better, fresh seafood & flame grilled skewers of deliciousness! The staff are effortlessly attentive & made our evening really special.

title: Trading on the Boundary name
comment: A very poor experience after a very nice experience at Tratra in the basement. We were secured a table by the lovely staff at Tratra having finished our meal. We arrived to be told that the only table we could have was right next to a patio heater which is only an enjoyable experience if you want to smell of BBQ and overheat. Tables that arrived after us were relocated but we were left in the corner and ignored. We ordered two very average cocktails, mine was gin and grapefruit and had WHOLE black pepper corns in it, yes WHOLE black pepper corns which went up the straw and caused me to cough up. Paid £28 for a round and with surly and unhelpful service. Trust me, there is no danger of getting drunk up here, service is so slow and apathetic, you wonder how the two businesses exist in the same building.

title: Great spot to relax in the sun
comment: Open roof top made it a great place to drink and relaxing in the sun. I am not sure what it would be like in the rain but recommended for a view and relaxing afternoon. A must when in this side of town

title: Okay on a sunny day
comment: We only popped in for a drink before getting the train home on one of the hottest Saturdays for a while.  Very busy, as you can imagine, but pleasant enough. Not overwhelmed by the drinks on offer and not enough ice for such a hot day. Seating is a little to be desired, my husband and I were very far apart on the table we were seated at which meant loudly talking & leaning over to one another. The strangers to my right and left were much closer which at more than one point felt a little uncomfortable. (Not that I was whispering sweet nothings, but you know, don't wish everything to be overheard!) Probably wouldn't hurry back if I'm honest.

title: Could be better
comment: I went for dinner on a Saturday evening. The rooftop is a nice spot on a sunny evening and the views are good. The food was very disappointing though. I had octopus and chorizo scewers which were over cooked and rubbery. My wife had chicken which was also tough. Considering the investment in the environment and the food is very expensive it really needs looking at. We had two gin Cocktails which were also a bit strong. Nice place and nice night but much room for improvement.

title: Saturday evening
comment: I just want to say how fantastic we felt during our visit at Boundary Rooftop. Outside was quite cold but the staff at Boundary provide us with blankets and they even made the fire outside on the terrace. The atmosphere was EPIC with the heaters and the fire place on.Good music in the background and the food is great. We had as well cocktails which were pricey but very good value. We will return.

title: Apres ski without mountains
comment: What a lovely surprise when we exited the lift onto the rooftop restaurant. Very tasteful set up and the staff were extremely helpful. The menu reflects that of food found in the Savoyard area continuing the apres ski theme. Relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere. Food lovely. Don’t expect a London skyline but eating alfresco is what it’s about. Thoroughly recommended.

title: Cozy roof terrace
comment: We visited for dinner with a friend. The outdoor space is very beautiful with plenty of cushions and fire pit. The food was good but not much to choose from the menu. We had a table in conservatory, quite romantic but it was cold inside. I will be coming back definitely

title: OK, wouldn’t rush to tetuen
comment: I had heard good things about Boundary but I was quite underwhelmed. The rooftop was nice but their are better rooftops in London with better views. The menu was strange and the portions small. The skewers were tasty but definitely not value for money, they were more snack size than main meal - however they were priced as a main meal. Perhaps the menu for the restaurant is better but I wouldn’t rush to return for this menu.

title: Good vibe and friendly staff
comment: This place is amazing. It has a really good vibe and in a good location with a good view from the rooftop. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the food was outstanding. Would highly recommend and will definitely return!

title: How can you get it so wrong!
comment: What a great venue, amazing terrace and building but that's where it ends. It takes a real skill to make such a mess of such a fantastic place - food was inedible, and when questioned if it was possible to make a gluten/dairy free salad was told " the chef is not there to be creative" service was beyond terrible, an absolute waste of a great venue. My advice, when it's raining and there are no customers, use the time to train your staff, on customer service, and your chef, how to cater for different food types.

title: Food was superb service was great
comment: I am so glad I didn't see the reviews before eating here last night . I had originally booked weeks ago for the summer rooftop dinning which was a complete wash out , due to rain . The food and service came up trumps . There were 7 of us ,the portions were great and the atmosphere was really good. I would definitely return when the sun comes out. There is one small gripe ,that seems to be happening in more and more restaurants . Mixed toilets such a no no for all 4 ladies in our group.

title: Nice rooftop
comment: We went to this rooftop with my boyfriend to take a drink and share some dishes ! The rooftop is very nice, lovely and with a very nice localisation ! We couldn't book for the rooftop, only the closed area (or maybe we just didn't find on the website). Cocktails are good but quite small for the price and the food is quite expensive , even if it was nice ! We will come back to just take a drink on the rooftop if we can but to eat, i'm not sure !

title: Date
comment: Me and brand new girlfriend :) had a fantastic date on Boundary Rooftop. The cocktails were really tasty and they do all the classic ones just need to ask, staff were taken great care of us. Thank you Boundary Rooftop we will be back.

title: Ana M
comment: We visited on a sunny Saturday afternoon when the terrace was pretty busy. Despite this the staff was very helpful, especially the manager Gabriel whose knowledge on coktails and food was excellent. The food was really tasty and the service impeccable. Five star treatement, will definitely visit again.

title: Really fab on a sunny warm day
comment: This roof terrace has so so much more potential, and yes, one could make it more elegant or at least cosy, and yes, the service could be a little more relaxed and caring, but two things stood out for me that I really enjoyed. Firstly, it is a lovely place to be when the sun shines, one feels like one is hovering over all the funki buildings and apartment tops, and secondly, and more importantly the food was fairly simple, but very good.
