Yes, it is not cheap by any stretch of imagination, for the money a long afternoon, of few champagnes, wine, 1 starter and two mains and some nibbles later cost as much as you would pay in a Michelin starred place at lunch, but with a setting like that, in the sun, one doesn't mind. The oysters were super fresh, the main of chicken skewer my friend had was fab, my seared tuna fantastic, the nibbles of crudités and wood fired focaccia type bread later in the afternoon was also very good. I would definitely go back there for the sun and the food.

title: Lovely evening
comment: Perfect date night, we had a lovely night here. Just came for drinks on the rooftop bar and they were worth the money

title: Dinner date
comment: I was visiting Boundary Rooftop with my girlfriend Friday night. The Rooftop looks amazing specially during the night with all the heaters on. They had a wedding going on which we didn't felt disturb at all. I had a ribeye steak and my girlfriend scallops and bacon . Both of the dishes were very tasty . I will return because it is a good spot to go out.

title: Great rooftop in the sun
comment: The food is so so & restricted because of the limitations of the grill. Lobster fared better than a pretty average chicken brochette. Salad with courgettes, peas & feta very nice. Good service. Still a bit of a must-do in the summer.

title: seafood choice
comment: I must say that our group enjoyed Boundary rooftop im Sunday. The quality of food and drinks is ine of the best in the area and Sunday we enjoyed a promotion after 8 o'clock of 50% from seafood .

title: Best terrace în London
comment: We visited The terrace in Wednesday. Crazy hot outside and Was Packed upstairs at Rooftop. However we had great time. Food, drinks and service Was amazing. I will be back. Thank you

title: Terrible Service
comment: I went with a group of friends to celebrate my friend's birthday at the Boundary Rooftop. We brought our own cake and Boundary Rooftop charged us a £20 handling fee, which we paid. Boundary Rooftop threw the cake box away and put the birthday cake in a plastic bag. I complained about this as this was very unhygienic. I waited 15 minutes before the waitress agreed to take the birthday cake out of the plastic bag and put it into a new box. Then the head chef turned to me and said "you are complaining because you are black people, you black people need to know your place and take the cake as it is, I do not know why you black people always like to cause trouble."  The manager refused to give me the head chef's name. The head chef continued saying "I have many sisters and females in my family so I will only take pity on you because there are many females in your group, the females need to know their place and carry themselves better." I told the head chef that I will be filing a police report for racist and sexist remarks. To which the head chef replied "I do not care, do what you want!" Least to say my friend's birthday celebration was ruined.

title: Cool terrace in Shoreditch with good food and wine
comment: We made a special trip out to Shoreditch to try out this rooftop. When you arrive, you check in with a desk downstairs and then a doorman lets you up the elevator. There was no room on the terrace so we started off in the restaurant and given that the temperature was in mid 30s we didn't like it. We asked the host to let us know if a seat came up outside.  We had most of our dinner inside and had a nice bottle of wine on the terrace. The host did offer us a seat outside but we didn't like the location near the exit. We passed on that one. Another 5 minutes and a table we liked did come up and we took it. The weather was splendid.  Our meal included a spring vegetable salad, grilled Asparagus and a Rabbit Terrine. However, the terrine was pre made in a jar and served as such. I had to pop open the jar as well. Not too impressed with that. Once on the terrace we ordered a nice bottle of chateau leoube from Provence and enjoyed the weather. The staff was friendly and we didn't have any issues with service.

title: Birthday
comment: This place was recommended it was amazing views but drinks choice poor and very expensive also breads tapas where dry they also take your card which now with tap and go is not very comfortable

title: Such a disappointment!
comment: After trying to book a table for a weekend we decided to go on a Tuesday night, only to have a huge disappointment.  Service was appalling at best, waiting long time for ordering, getting wrong drinks, getting food for other tables. The waitress was new, but she didn't care. Management should not allow that. Food wise, we ordered "steak". A £28 shoe sole. Probably £4.50 at Sainsbury's. View was nice, but nothing special. Such a pity such a "big" name and a location with such potential, is so poorly managed.

title: Nice roof terrace for a drink
comment: We turned up here without booking, and managed to get a small table for 2 really quickly. I liked the decor, and the atmosphere was ok (once we'd got past the front deck, which seemed a bit pretentious considering the people upstairs were dressed in sports clothes). Service was good - friendly and fast. The view from this roof bar isn't anything spectacular and the cocktails are overpriced for what they are, but I guess you're paying for the 'cool Shoreditch thing'. Worth a visit if you're in the area, but there are definitely better roof terraces in the city - this one isn't really worth travelling out of your way for.

title: Super lunch
comment: Couple of us had visited Boundary Rooftop in a sunny day. The food was delicious not too many choices however right to the point.  Drinks - we didn't go for cocktails but we're many people on large cocktails glasses. We had champagne Veuve for a good price.  I will return.

title: Great outdoor terrace
comment: The rooftop was amazing service and food of highest quality will definitely be visiting again. I do suggest to try it yourself.

title: bad service, average food...poor overall
comment: whilst the terrace is pretty and during the week days during working hours only and with the sun out is relaxing, all the rest is appalling; I went there for lunch yesterday with another person and they made us sit in a table literally attached to a noisy big table; nobody came to take order for 10 mins, we decided to change table when we saw one that was free and again they left us there with the dirty glasses that people before us used. One guy was going around with a tray not having a clue what to collect, the main waiter that gave us the table passed few times without asking and I had to stand up and cdall them to take the order. Beer brought were warm and no glasses offered, no cutlery given with food and I had to stand up to go and get them, food is very average....do not go there and eat what they give you for 25-28 pounds as a main dish it is totally not worth it; I refused to pay the service and I will definitely not going to eat there again; only good for drinks in weekdays and during office hours...if they have a reputation i am not sure where it comes from Antonio

title: A small disappointment...
comment: I wanted to visit this rooftop restaurant during all summer and always circumstances were against me. So it was like an annoying idea to get to this place.  And I was sooo excited to get a table for 3 for saturday night! I thought Im lucky;)) How sad I was to leave this place hungry...  The hotel and a restaurant are very stylish, but I really didn't understand what is all that hype about? And theres no magnificent view....

title: Best dinner ever
comment: I must say that our expectations weren't high when we did our booking but when we arrived we've been greeted by a nice hostess service the food as you can seen fantastic and the service was impecable. I don't the name of the gentleman who was looking after however he was a true profesional the way he was working. Anyway I think he was the restaurant manager because it seems everybody was listening to him and he was the only one wearing a tie. We will return.

title: Amazing atmosphere on a Saturday afternoon!
comment: Great terrace with a beautiful vue. Don't hesitate to come and bring your friends along. Excellent service! The weather was also great with amazing views of Shoreditch area.

title: Nice for a Sunny Day
comment: Visited at noon for drinks and nibbles to experience a mediterranean style outdoor experience on a roof terrace on a rare London sunny day. The terrace is pleasantly laid out with a nice ambience induced by planted greenery and shrubs. Although the Italian breads and accompanying spreads dips were nice and fresh, the food for us vegetarians was not very exciting, and a bit too bland for our more adventurous taste buds. The table waiters were however very pleasant and attentive.  So just be aware you are probably paying for the atmosphere rather than the dining experience.

title: You had me at half-price seafood Sunday!!
comment: Gorgeous rooftop bar with an awesome view. Reserve a table online for their half off oysters and lobsters. Surprised that it wasn't packed. Unfortunately was on my own...so, please don't waste the moment--invite someone. Asparagus was fresh (9). Ordered a dozen oysters (1/2 price at 12) which were delicious. 1/2 lobster at 11 was fine...nothing glamorous as it's literally just a grilled lobster tail and they can be kind of tough. The Viognier (7) was a good way to wash it down. Tarte du jour (7) was apple and just okay--kind of dry. Enjoyed a nice Talisker (11) to finish it off.

title: rooftop experience
comment: Visited Boundary rooftop restaurant on a gorgeous sunny Sunday. This is a must visit place in London in the heart of Shoreditch. Not only the place in lively, the views are astonishing and the food is great. Perfect for the afternoon/evening with friends or a date. They have a lot of amazing cocktails, perfect and refreshing on those summer days. Highly recommended. Will definitely be back soon. Keep up the good work.

title: Worst terrace and food ever!
comment: This place is a mess .... i will try to be brief but detailed to explain how terrible it was: we booked 3 weeks ago and when we arrived little earlier we asked to wait at the bar and they said to come back later that it was difficult etc etx we insisted and finally they said fine.... it was funny then when upstairs the terrace was almost empty and never got busy as the weather was not that sunny. Food was very low quality ... you can see the photos my tuna was a steak just thrown on a plate with some pieces of vegetables... i asked for medium rear and actually it was medium-well done.... my friends asked for medium and it was rear......we ordered a cocktail's jar and it was served in a horrible bottle with horrible glasses and it was practically full of ice only. The menu looks boring it was only skewers and steak.... we did not order dessert as we prefer move to another place. Service was low standard the waiter asked as to repeat things many times and when he took the payment we said how we wanted to split the bill and he did not trusted our counting and was writing on a piece of paper and counting in front of us .....never happen in any place before! The terrace is not bad as a location the view however is not that great! It is super overpriced for the quality and the service. I had the feeling that they do not have any idea in what hospitality means!!!! Never never again and i will definitely discourage my friends to go in that place.

title: Superb Sunday chill out place
comment: I visited Sunday the Rooftop with couples of friends from Australia and I need to say we had an epic time at Boundary. The weather was on the cold side but they provide us with blankets, gas heaters and even umbrellas in case was raining which is a cool touch. I need to say was unusual busy for Sunday which after one hour I understood why . They had good music any cocktail what you requested was made and the best was the seafood which was on offer on Sunday 50 % .

title: Poor
comment: Came for a birthday meal and the birthday girl's meal came 10 minutes later than everyone else's because the waitress forgot to put the meal through (which she did not apologise for). I asked for my steak to be blue and it came more like medium well (but again she did not ask how my meal was even though i left 3/4 of the steak). The location is however nice on the rooftop and the chocolate almond birthday cake was very good. All in all, an expensive and below average meal. Would not recommend.

title: Appalling service and overpriced food
comment: We visited for a family birthday meal. The steak was very poor quality, oily and salty. We didn't see our waitress for 45 min, we were not offered deserts or second drinks or even asked if we were happy with our meals. When the waitress finally cleared the table I had to point out the issues with the steak. Two members of our group had steak and majority was left on both plates, a good waitress would have noticed this and asked if there was anything wrong. The response from the waitress was she was sorry it wasn't to our taste! It was a poor cut of meat and with a £30 price tag we felt ripped off. We had to ask for more water throughout the afternoon, we were sitting in front of the bar in view of all the staff, so you would have thought this would have been spotted. Were so disappointed with our visit, if your thinking of trying this place, maybe just go for drinks but be prepared to wait!

title: Superb wiews over Shoreditch
comment: I just visited this Saturday Boundary rooftop on recomandation and I need to say that I didnt regret it . Sunny day outside with amazing views over Shoreditch area and the food was soooo good. I do sugest to try it yourself.

title: One of the best roof terraces in London
comment: Couple of days ago I took the decision to visit Boundary Rooftop restaurant to chill for a while after work. Cocktails were tasty and the views amazing with great lounge music on the background overlooking Shoreditch area.

title: Lovely for drinks
comment: Just popped into this place for a couple of cocktails after a meal elsewhere. Went straight to the rooftop which was a little busy but we copped a squat very quickly ....we were served by very pleasant waiting staff which is always greatly received. The cocktails I find were quite pricey by glass so best to buy by the pitcher.  I could hear a faint bit of music in the back ground which I wish had been turned up a couple of notches or switched off completely.  Nevertheless it was a nice a chilled relax vibe ....beautiful when the sun was shining too. They've made 7se of the space well and have heaters on the roof to to keep you warm. Drinks and food available. Thank you for the hospitality Boundary look forward to coming back to eat here.

title: Great outdoor terrace
comment: We just visited the rooftop couple of days ago and I must say we did enjoy the weather and the signatures cocktails . We felt look after also by staff providing us with blankets. Thank you Rooftop

title: One of the best
comment: I am saying in the context that I believe is one of the best rooftop terraces in London for good on the grill, chill out music, setting of the place and cocktail.

title: Saturday Drinks
comment: Couple of us we visit rooftop restaurant for drinks on Saturday. We had a fantastic time even our waiter was busy. Good choice of cocktails and the squid and chorizo was tasty.

title: Girls day out
comment: We did visit the Boundary rooftop Sunday which was an amazing day the relax in the sun with my girls. They have a good selections of cocktails and service was fast and prompt considering was a queue outside and waited around half and hour the go up.

title: Average food and views
comment: Was there for a birthday and we were 7. The table was not big enough and some people were uncomfortable and at moments it was also cold. Also we did tell them it was a birthday but they didn't provide any detail or present. They serve mainly French food and it my opinion all the dishes I tried were just ok, nothing too exceptional. Prices are high, around 50-60£ and portions are decent. Even if it was a rooftop the building is pretty low so views were not amazing. Regardless of all the mediocre comments from above the dinner was great thanks to the nice people I was with!

title: Poor Value for Money Restaurant
comment: This place is just for cocktails.  The food at the restaurant is overpriced. It is as expensive as Mayfair but has a poor service and poor presentation. The bread that comes with the antipasti/mezze is old, the antipasti itself doesn't appear to be homemade. The lobster was overcooked. The service is also poor. One has to wait over 10 minutes just to get the menu, and if one needs anything else, one has to ask twice. For this type of service and food, it is a rip off. The reviews of those having cocktails are positive due to the terrace. Definitely not recommended. Shoreditch has far better places.

title: Fantastic work dinner!
comment: Had a great evening here on the rooftop for dinner with my work team of 11. Sharif, the Event Manager was a dream to work with. He was quick, efficient and responded to all my questions in a timely manner. The dinner was fantastic, especially the chicken skewers. The service was also top notch and the staff were extremely friendly and were there if you needed anything. I would definitely recommend the Boundary and we will for sure be re-visiting again. Thanks Sharif and the team, we had a fantastic evening!

title: Huge Prices, Small Portions, Terrible Service
comment: Three friends and I ate at this restaurant last Friday and it was a terrible experience. The service was appalling, we had to go to the bar to ask if we could get a drink, then it took at least 10 minutes and it was not busy it was 15.30 in the afternoon.  We then sat down to eat where we were charges £32 each for a Rib Eye steak, they forgot to bring the chips which it should be served with, again we had to ask and it cost £10 for tow green leaf salads. With the steak you could have one sauce option only. It was my birthday and my wife had arranged a small chocolate desert with a candle as way of marking it, they forgot to bring this out, again she had to go up and ask. When the bill arrived it was £284.31 which included £32.31 for service, which we should have refused to pay. It was very over prices, very poor service and all in all a bad experience. Perhaps this is trendy East London but take my advice and don't bother.

title: Nothing special
comment: Straight to the point, the starter was too salty and the steak was too small for the price. All in all, I wouldn't come back. We didn't have the dessert, I just had a feeling it would be a further disappointment.

title: Avoid
comment: It was my first and last visit... avoid avoid avoid. Very unpleasant service, rude staff,2 double espresso and desert £16.99 really? For this service?! No. There are much nicer places in London with better view and service!

title: So disappointing. Will never return.
comment: I live locally to the Boundary, and have had positive experiences dining both at the Albion and the main restaurant. This time, I wanted to celebrate a special event and decided the ambiance and view of the rooftop would be a great way to do that. I was not disappointed in that respect - the atmosphere is lovely. However, the service and food really let them down. We ordered a wide selection of food, including the deluxe platter with half lobster, chorizo and octopus, sea trout, lamb cutlets, and a whole lobster.  Firstly, the food was thrown at us SO quickly. It felt very much like they were trying to get rid of us ASAP. Maybe it was a result of this over-rapid service that the food was so awful. Firstly the deluxe platter - the cockels were not washed properly at all and were very sandy and unpleasant to eat. The oysters also had not been opened properly, and there bits of shell in it. Then, the sea trout was served to us completely raw, cold and uncooked in the middle. When we sent it back, there was really no apology, no acknowledgement that we had been served completely raw fish.  Lobster was a bit rubbery, and they didn't prepare it properly i.e. crack the shell slightly before serving.  The only enjoyable dish we had was the octopus and chorizo.  I will never return again. Such a disappointing experience, and I feel upset that I had trusted the Boundary brand to 'host' a special evening for myself and my family.

title: Snail pace service and over prices
comment: Clearly short staffed but still the service was ridiculously slow. Had to wait for booked table and wait an age for them to take out first order. Order champagne only to be told it wasn't cold and we'd have to wait at least 10 minutes... When oysters arrived they didn't know how to serve them, as in they couldn't work out the stand the plates went on! Cocktails very average. We went to celebrate a friends 40th but left feeling very disappointed and let down

title: Amazing views
comment: The views here were stunning. They also provided blankets for when it got colder which was a lovely touch. They had a range of cocktails and wine. It was a lovely place for a date.

title: The food is amazing, the atmosphere impeccable and the staff very friendly!
comment: My husband and I had the best romantic dinner ever. The food was amazing we had for dinner Grilled lobster garlic and parsley butter with fries and aïoli I can honestly tell you that this was the best lobster that we ate in a while. Desserts to dye for!! Recommend Petit pot au chocolat absolutely amazing. The view is spectacular, the food and drinks are reasonably priced with friendly attentive service. Definitely, we are coming back!

title: Amazing Place
comment: The Boundary Rooftop was amazing!! Really impressive panoramic view and I loved the food, especially the chorizo and squid skewers.The staff is really friendly and fun. Just a super place for a sunny day . I can wait to come back ....Highly recommended !!

title: Fantastic place for dinner
comment: One of my favourite restaurants in London. Service impeccable and friendly. The food is excellent, always perfectly cooked and the waiters extremely knowledgeable. Love the roof garden and excellent outdoor. Recommend to everyone.

title: Rooftop Easter lunch
comment: Amazing lunch with great service, delicious seafood platter. Beautiful views over Shoreditch area. Stunning views over the city in a lovely atmosphere. Lovely service variety of food and drinks options.

title: Very average food but nice staff and cocktails
comment: I went with friends on Friday night and had a lovely evening, although this was more down to company than the food. VENUE The venue is definitely for the Summer, although there are some nice fire pits outside to keep you warm if seated. Spacing is good so you don't feel intrusive on other diners. We personally love cheese, but if you're not a fan it will get VERY pungent in the rooftop room so be warned. FOOD For starters, we had the Le grand aperitif Méditerranéen with mediterranean bread and octopus & chorizo skewers. All of these was overwhelmingly average, and nothing stood out. For mains, I had half lobster with chips and aioli, and my friends had the steak. The steak was ok and the half lobster was quite dry but ok (it's lobster so you can't go too wrong), but again, nothing to write home about. COCKTAILS We had the Earth & Smoke and Gindilla, which were all very nice and would recommend. SERVICE Service was attentive and polite so definitely no issues. OVERALL I would definitely recommend for drinks on the rooftop in the Summer, and maybe some snacks if you want some food but would not recommend for dinner.

title: Expensive, average food quality and service doesn't match brand expectation
comment: We had been trying to get a reservation at Boundary for some time on the Rooftop where it is relatively hard to find a decent booking due to popularity. My immediate feedback would be "go elsewhere" - they charge £27 for a rib eye that was...maybe 6 ounces and flat? The rest of the meal was very average and the service was sub par - our server(s) didn't really know their wine list and we felt the gin and tonics were terrible. Maybe it was just a bad night for them but as I say on all my "less than stellar" reviews, there are too many places that are better to consider returning here.

title: Location Top!
comment: Amazing and quite roof top! Wine 7/10  good wine list but nothing special Cocktail 6/10  To many ingredients in every cocktail  Location 8/10 What else?!?  Service 4/10 They came 4/5 times in 5 mins after our arrival to push us to order!  ££££ 6/10 Everything is good but you are mostly paying the location not the quality.

title: Decidedly average and overpriced
comment: I was here for a friend's birthday dinner on the rooftop. The two greeters were very polite and the ambience was ideal but that's where a lot of the positivity ends. For the cost, the food was underwhelming. I had the burrata and fries with aioli. The burrata was fine but ultimately, cheese on a plate. The fries were soggy towards the bottom of the serving and we had to request more aioli as they brought out one serving for three portions. Two of the party had the quinoa salad which was sent back due to being bland. This was rectified but a £15 salad should come out right the first time. I also paid £12.50 for the smallest 'long' cocktail I have ever been served. The service was also very slow once we were seated. If you go here, I would recommend going just for drinks and possibly a dessert (the chocolate pot was good but there were unexpected chunks). Not worth the money I spent there.

title: BURNT
comment: Roof top has a decent view but it was completely ruined by the poor quality of food. For the price you pay the food is below average at best. We had 2 tuna and a steak and all of them taste burnt as it was definitely charred for too long. If you are looking for somewhere which you pay expensive prices for really low quality food this is what you are looking for.

title: Great ambience though a little pricey
comment: Attended for a birthday gathering. Lovely decor and views, staff friendly and helpful. Perhaps a little pricey for what it is but we enjoyed it. Would recommend the raclette to share.

title: Business drinks
comment: Group of 30 - 35 for networking drinks and nibbles. Location good, sadly a wet evening so not able to fully enjoy. Service good, quite expensive.

title: Memorable evening
comment: Love London rooftops and Boundary is one of them. Lovely friendly service. Food fresh and appealing. Steak was nice and tender and the meats starter was amazing. Sat outside for a couple of drinks under a blanket and by the heater, good chat looking at Shoreditch rooftops. Nice place to take friends from outside London. Impresive. (Not cheap at £17 for a single rum and coke) £180 for 3 mains, one sharing starter, bread, no dessert 4 beers and two rums.

title: Best Nicoise Salad I've Ever Had
comment: I found that the service at the Boundary Rooftop Restaurant was amazing. Our waiter was really friendly and the atmosphere was very relaxed. The views from the rooftop were stunning and I must admit, the Nicoise salad was the best I've ever had.

title: Excellent food and great views
comment: This is an out of the ordinary type experience and somewhere for a special occasion. Very unusual surroundings with views over Shoreditch from the roof of the Boundary Hotel and some unusual dishes of high quality.

title: Good food, poor atmosphere, too expensive
comment: We had dinner at the rooftop restaurant on a Sunday evening from 7 PM, and for the first hour we were the only guests in the restaurant. That effected the mood somewhat, and the staff weren't as attentive as I would have expected. We had difficulty catching their attention when we wanted to order, and different waiters came to our table asking the same questions. Also, the music was too loud.  The food was very nice indeed, and seen in isolation, the food is definitely recommendable. The pricing is though a bit of a miss especially the atmosphere taking into consideration. We had salmon crostini as starters, boeuf bearnaise for main course, and creme brûlée for dessert. We only had a very small bowl of bearnaise. When asked for more bearnaise, there was no problem getting additional sauce, but the extra sauce was unfortunately cold. Also we did not quite understand why the water was not cooled?!

title: Rushed, bad food but good service...
comment: We decided to book here for a friends birthday dinner. As the weather was going to be good, Boundary rooftop was a preferred choice. The booking was for 9.45pm as that was the earliest available. We are ok about eating late so we went ahead with the booking. We arrived 10mins late at 9.55pm.  We were greeted by the manager and she was very lovely and friendly. We were shown to our table which was at a brilliant position with a huge big sofa. Our waitress came up and gave us our menus, she was extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. Unfortunately within a couple of minutes of receiving our menus another member of staff came up to notify us that the kitchen will be closing in five minutes and that we had to quickly order if we wanted dinner. Feeling quite rushed we ordered a couple of platter to share and then our mains, only to be told everything will arrive at the same time!!! Feeling slightly annoyed, I guess there was nothing else we could have said. We ordered wine too. Dinner and platters arrived at the same time. The seafood platter was good, large and lovely with a variety of mussels, oyster, prawns and crab. The hot food was average at best. Bland and tasteless. Unfortunately before long (11.30pm), we had another staff member come along to say, sorry we are closing soon. You'll have to finish your food and drinks so we can pack up. So were once again, hurried along to pay and asked to leave. We felt that it was such a joke, it was beyond funny. Why take a dinner booking for 9.45 if your kitchen closes at 10-10.15pm? It was birthday dinner that was rushed, and very average. Definitely do not recommend this place for a nice relaxing dinner. Despite the friendly and lovely staff, food as mentioned average and whole process rushed and ruined the night.

title: Awesome roof terrace mediocre food.
comment: Great spot for drinks . I had the worst Nicoise salad. Mainly peppers. Other food was forgettable and pricey.

title: Extremely disappointed
comment: Booked Boundary rooftop for a Saturday brunch in August. Luckily the weather was lovely so we could enjoy the sunshine outside.  We took our seats, ordered a drink and waited for a menus to arrive. The brunch menus were somewhat lacking with not much variety.  We went ahead and ordered an almond croissant, fruit bowl and a bacon sandwich.  A few of the items were not available so we could not have our first choice.  The drinks had still not arrived but at least we were enjoying the sunshine.  Drinks finally arrived, a coffee and some grapefruit juice.  Brunch arrived after 30 minutes but not the correct brunch. Eggs and salmon arrived instead of the bacon sandwich. The waiter apologised and reordered the sandwich.  The croissant was huge and rather cake like in texture. Not the sweet flakey pastry that I was after.  The fruit bowl with yogurt which we ordered to share was not as I expected. Instead it was small chunks of fruit in orange juice with a small dish of yoghurt on the side.  The waiter came over to check on our food and was surprised when I mentioned that we were still waiting for the bacon sandwich.  After I'd finished my croissant and fruit the bacon sandwich arrived. We then knew why it took so long. Anticipating a juicy thick bacon sandwich, we were presented with dry over cooked charred bacon on dry bread with no sauce. We requested some sauce and all they had was tomato. My partner couldn't even finish his sandwich as it was bitter and crisp.  We soon asked for the bill so we could make our quick escape. The bill arrived and we asked not to pay service, the waiter then went off for ten minutes to check this was okay with the manager.  We sharply departed and made better use of the Starbucks stand outside that was handing out free coffees.

title: What is the hype ?
comment: After a long wait,we finally got a table at the Boundary for an early dinner.The hostess on the door greeted us with sorry you have a table downstairs not on the roof , which I know I had booked ages ago, finally after phoning the Roof Terrace to find there were no tables she then realized she had read the paper work wrong ! In all fairness she was very polite and apologetic :) We were seated under cover which was not stated when I booked as I thought we would be outside,there was no atmosphere in-fact it was a bit chaotic staff running about moving tables while we ate !!!  We ordered a cocktail while we looked the menu, with a very nice friendly waitress. We had the octopus and chorizo to start £12 for 2 tiny skewers , that was very,very chewy.We then had the seafood platter to share.I have had many seafood platters from high end restaurant to pubs by the sea, and this was the most tasteless fish I have ever tasted , this was accompanied by a very warm bottle of white wine .We had . Finished the food and just wanted to get out so we just paid for 2 tiny glasses not even a full 175 glass !!! and we were still charged £12 ! I dont mind paying anything for good food , but this is very poor and mid to high prices very disappointed and wont be going back !! Nice helpful waitress she would be better working somewhere else to good for the Boundary

title: Absolutely amazing!
comment: An absolute amazing rooftop bar! Food was spot on, the place is flawless and the manageress as well as all the staff were superb/absolutely outstanding! I was out celebrating my birthday with a large group and we were all super impressed! Thanks for making my day special!

title: Great location and rooftop - food ok
comment: Rooftop restaurant has a great buzz. Good outdoor seating space for a drink, can be cramped for dinner if you sit outside and a large conservatory with more formal dining - gets hot, if the sun shines, ok that's rare in London.  This place is Shoreditch cool and attracts all the hipsters. French menu with limited choice - not a criticism 6 or 7 choices per course. The food is ok and a little hit and miss, the same could be said for the staff some are v helpful some can't speak too much English.  Def place to visit for the vibe and setting but you wouldn't visit just for the food, if you want great French food use the restaurant downstairs in the basement its amazing, top draw.

title: Rooftop Bar Visit - great location, poor service
comment: Luckily we booked ahead for lunch - wouldn't fancy queuing! Food was very good, drinks are quirky. Service was dreadful. When we didn't pay the optional 12.5% service charge, we were told we had underpaid. When we told them why we weren't paying it, there was a discussion amongst the staff for about 15 mins before we were given back our change. Has put me off of returning.

title: Best Rooftop in London!
comment: Amazing.I celebrated my birthday here and had such a great night. From the super helpful door staff at the entry to the delightful, good looking manager chap (Sean I think his name is?), the service is friendly and informative. Food is amazing, the chips were perfectly cooked (and I know my chips, trust me). Espresso Martini's were fabulous. Cannot fault it. Big 10/10 to the Boundary.

title: Good food but mediocre service
comment: We chose to have the chorizo and octopus skewers as they had run out of burrata. These were gender and flavoursome. The service was lacking though and we felt more neglected than other guests sat nearby. It wasn't particularly busy either for that to have been an excuse. Nice rooftop though as it is not as busy as places such as Radio and Madison.

title: Up on the roof
comment: Great service, wonderful steaks and oysters, green salad a bit droopy, it was a hot evening! Lovely, lovely chocolate pots and Banyals . Great views and delicious expression martinis- what a great way to spend a Sunday evening, and half price seafood too

title: Wonderful lunch ! Great service
comment: My daughter booked the Boundary rooftop restaurant as we were visiting in London , she had been there before and enjoyed it very much. 5 of us in our party , arrived , no problems straight to table , cold water served immediately, all of our food was of a very high quality , starters of assorted breads with balsamic vinegar , burrata and vine tomatoes, really tasty , the chicken skewers were also some of the best I have tasted and the other mains of lamb cutlets and a vegetarian quinoa also received very well , the desserts , creme brulee , seasonal tart and pot au chocolat were amazing. A very good lunch in a very hospitable restaurant , what made it even better was our waitress Mary , always smiling always helpful , a credit to the restaurant. Thank you.

title: Nice location very disappointing food
comment: Booked a table at rooftop, table wasn't ready for lunch and glad to wait for it to be set. Ordered cocktails - very good! The food was disappointing, with a small menu expectations were high for quality.  Quinoa salad for starter was very average. Three of the group ordered chicken kebabs. One was sent back other two barely touched. The kebab was a mixture of breast and dark meat. Served at a tepid temperature and the texture was very unappealing.  Service ok, but again expected a bit more considering the prices. Would go back for the roof terrace and cocktails but many places better to eat.

title: Good but not quite good enough
comment: Had lunch, nice roof top setting, decor a little tired, comfortable outside area, bit squashed up inside. Food was good, well cooked and tasty, pricing was reasonable for London, slightly disappointed with the service, slow with the drinks and did not feel they paid enough attention around.  We enjoyed our meal and on another day they might get it all right.

title: Lousy Service with great views
comment: We had booked a table for 2 on the terrace on sunday evening and were looking forward to our visit. Unfortunately what should have been an enjoyable dining experience was let down by poor service due to a lack of waiting staff. It seemed there was only one waitress covering the entire area. We had to ask for menus, nobody came for 10 minutes to take our first drinks order and we had to play 'let's try and flag down the staff'. After we had finished starters nobody came to take away our plates until again we flagged down staff. The food was average and not worth the premium price. After dinner we realised that we had enough and decided it would be quicker to go home for dessert. The waitress apologised at the end of the evening and said she was 'run off her feet'. I don't blame her it was management that needed to properly staff the restaurant. Trying to cut corners simply backfires, you create a poor customer experience and potential repeat customers like ourselves will not go back.  I asked the waitress about the service charge at the end and if she gets it - it was shared by all staff. I asked her to take it off the bill and instead I gave it to her in cash for herself. She was very happy, she did try her best so I felt she deserved it, it was management's failure to staff the restaurant which was the issue combined with average food which was not worth the premium.

title: A disappointment
comment: I was so looking forward to going to Boundary. We had lunch at the rooftop. The food is overpriced for what you get, it's nothing special. we paid almost £80 for a shared starter, two mains and non alcoholic drinks. The salmon crostini was good, my main chicken skewers, I later learned weren't cooked properly as I had a bout of food poisoning later that night. They bought out a fruit tart for dessert which had mouldy raspberries on. I would say avoid. If you want to go for the view then drinks at the bar are advised, or the actual restaurant might be better.

title: You can do SO much better - terrible food/drink for value
comment: Visited Boundary rooftop for a friends birthday on Saturday and was really disappointed with our experience there. Don't usually write reviews for London restaurants unless I feel especially passionate about my experience... And for the value, this really was up there axone of my worst restaurant experiences in the city! Chosen primarily for it's rooftop, we got lucky with the weather and booked a table for 8pm for a group of six. We were given a table under the canopy which meant our view was largely obstructed and I have to say, it's not really THAT nice of a cityscape in London. Think you could do better at another rooftop bar or restaurant. The service was super slow - we didn't get asked for a drink order for half an hour, although I do have to say the waitress we did have WAS very charming and seemed rushed off her feet.  Looking at the prices, we expected big things. The cocktails (cheapest at 10.50) were honestly nothing above average, like REALLY average (didn't help we'd just come from Sky Garden where the cocktails were the same price and pretty spectacular - highly recommended.) The menu is shalier on the rooftop and we ordered bread and olives. Olives were probably the highlight of the whole meal! Majority of us ordered the rib eye steak and wow, were we disappointed. All ordered medium rare, they arrived all rare - mainly because they were flame grilled so they were burnt on the outside and raw in the middle. We muddled through, coating it in the bernaise sauce and alioli and chips (alioli was good!) Mine steak was 50% though, and when you are paying £27 for a steak (not including a side) you expect it to be a good, tasty cut. Considering the likes of Hawksmoore, Gaucho and Goodmans you can get a basic cut at £20... I was really disappointed at how awful this was.  I NEVER complain (too British) but my friend took the liberty for me and I have to say, they did more than some restaurants might. Admittedly what I wanted was some money knocked off the steak, but they instead offered free desserts for the table. And to their word, they gave us one of every dessert, which made for a nice treat at the end (though did spoil the birthday cake we had but thats sods law.) I cannot stress more that you can do SO much better for your money in London. At a stretch it's nice for a drink on one of the sofas on the main rooftop, but I'd steer clear of the food.

title: Slow...and just service was awful
comment: Like another reviewer wrote below its the little things that add up. Took my fiance here for his birthday as he wanted to go to a rooftop bar. Atmosphere was only plus point.  We got drinks - second round had to ask for a drink they forgot even though it was repeated as they took the order Asked for condiments for starters - waiter acknowledged and never bought it to us Asked for tissues for hands as we ate the starters that didnt arrive either. Asked for the bill -waiter said yes took more than 15 minutes watching him walk around, till I realised I had to ask someone else. As soon as a waitress came with the bill I asked to straight away rather than wait any longer. Whats worse is there were plenty of staff. Either chit chatting away or just dont know what they are doing.  4 hendrick cocktails, chips, 2 desserts £80 including service which wasnt even deserved but I paid regardless. DESSERTS TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY - overly priced for sure.

title: Nice views but not worth the visit :(
comment: My husband and I visited the Boundary rooftop restaurant for our anniversary. I ordered an expensive white wine which turned up warm, I was given ice and an ice bucket, not perfect but there was no other option. We were brought a glass of champagne each as a sorry. We ordered our food and our starters arrived and were delicious, especially the oysters. Then our mains arrived and my husband was given the incorrect order and my chicken skewers tasted burnt, so we promptly sent them back.  I was offered an alternative and my husband brought his correct order. I ordered the tuna as an alternative. This arrived 10 mins later and was completely raw, so I sent this back, it was again the wrong order and was meant for a different customer. I was then brought my correctly cooked tuna, which unfortunately tasted burnt again... I promptly sent this back as it was inedible! We were brought more champagne and a pudding between us as an apology, we got the bill and left. I was very disappointed with everything about our visit, the service, the quality of food and the lack of interest in our complaints. I have to point out that I am not a fussy eater at all and in fact, if food is edible I will eat it! As we left the manager did offer us a free meal to make up for the problems encountered. But to be honest if you have the choice of thousands of good restaurants in London go for one of those and just visit the Boundary for drinks on the rooftop bar..

title: Triumph of form over substance!
comment: We had dinner on the rooftop to celebrate a birthday. Despite having completed the special information section on the booking form, this went unnoticed. The service was slow and disorganised with too many " managers" wafting around and too few doing the grunt work. We had to ask to be served and the table wasn't cleared between courses. The food was okay, but very plain with little in the way of presentation. Our white wine, when it eventually arrived, was warm. Clearly a very popular spot, but needs to get the basics right.

title: Disappointing
comment: Came here for the rooftop bar. Queue was short but took ages, a man in a suit came out with a clipboard asking how many of us there were and advised us it was one in one out as they were busy. It all looked very professional and organised and after a 20 minute wait and a few phone calls (presumably to the top floor) he said he had only large tables available so two pairs of us could sit at a large table which was fine with us and the couple behind us in the queue. So we went up the lift and when we got to the top literally nobody knew what was going on. The staff member that greeted us looked like she wasn't expecting us, and she said she only had small tables... So she squeezed us in where she could and gave us menus. We then ordered a couple of beers to be told they had run out of peroni at 5pm on a Saturday... So I had to have a small bottle of Meteor, which is French, and tasted awful. And it cost £5. They could do so much more with it, but they insist on putting potted plants everywhere, half of which are dead, that take up space that I think would be better used with stand-up tables or something. Views are quite good. Not somewhere I'll be going back to.

title: Good choice
comment: Nice food and nice atmosphere. We were able to enjoy the terrace without disconfort due to the weather. Good service as well .

title: Should be so much better....
comment: Ate here with a group of ladies on a sunny Sunday recently and was looking forward to a long lunch: who knew how long. Every round of drinks we had to get up and go looking for a waiter/waitress and the food - when our order was eventually taken and it arrived - was very disappointing. A £12 sharing platter of smoked salmon crostini was essentially out of a packet, with crème fraiche that looked like it had been thrown at the plate from a great height across just six 'crostini' the size of a ten pence piece. Mains were bland and took an hour to arrive after repeatedly asking to order. This is a great space that should be so much better. Won't be returning.

title: We had a great time!
comment: Great food, great views and amazing service- very attentive and kind waiters! Will definitely go again soon. Make sure you sit outside if the weather is good!

title: A little slice of France in London
comment: Visited this weekend with a group of friends. We’d originally booked a table inside but decided to swap this for the terrace because the weather was lovely (for once!). The service was good - attentive without being overbearing - and the Provence rose was delicious. The menu offers a good selection of sharing plates too. The roof terrace gets very busy in the late afternoon so would suggest going early to avoid disappointment.

title: Terrible Disorganisation Spoiling a Beautiful Venue
comment: My boyfriend and I visited Boundary Rooftop on Saturday night for my birthday. We had booked a table at 9.15pm but when we arrived, we were treated as though we didn't have a booking. We were left to stand around for around 15 minutes while they tried to get us a table, and we felt very much in the way (other people were being asked to wait too). The head waitress/manager (not sure which) then asked if we would mind sitting outside for a while and having a drink until another table finished up. This was actually fine by us - it was still warm outside and the terrace is beautiful. However once again we were left waiting around and by 10pm we still didn't even have a drink despite bringing it to the attention of the waiter. The head waitress then came back and apologised, and asked if we would like to order our food. She said that by the time the food arrived our table would be ready. We ordered the food which then arrived to our outside table, because the table indoors was STILL not ready. I complained and we were finally moved indoors - bearing in mind this was over an hour after we had booked a table. Our food order was also wrong but we couldn't be bothered to get someone's attention to fix it. The whole team were completely disorganised and we heard them being quite rude to each other - they were obviously stressed. On a positive note the restaurant itself is beautiful - with lovely lights and views over the city. Overall I will not be returning -. I would encourage the staff to visit the Ivy Garden or Balthazar to see how they should be treating their customers.

title: A must do on a sunny day!
comment: Just popped in here for a quick glass of rose and some nibbles in the sun, and thought I had to go on trip advisor and comment on how great the place was. Purely all down to the fact that on a sunny day they were offering out sun cream to all there customers - how thoughtful is that?! It's little things like that you remember. As usual the Italian breads were scrumptious, the waiters ever polite and attentive and the morrocan rose a delight! If you're in shoreditch and its a sunny day - make your way here

title: Not what it used to be
comment: I must say I was quite disappointed by the Boundary Rooftop. I have been since last summer- for food that is, not just cocktails, and it really has gone downhill. The service was awful and the food was quite bland. I guess it's always the same in London, you either have great food or great views when it comes to the few roof terraces that around. One of the two always lacks and in this case, it is definitely the latter. I do enjoy going there for cocktails, its a haven away from Shoreditch and especially compared to Shoreditch house next door.

title: this restaurant is a pricey joke!
comment: We visited this restaurant because my friend visiting from other country wanted to experience the rooftop restaurant in london. We arrived here, ordered starters, oyster, ratatouille, seabream and lamb. Apparently here they served the soup with waiter's thumb as well; the ratatouille never been able to show up; and it took AGES to grill the lamb and it wasn't medium as the waitress suggested at all, it was totally well-done. We sent the lamb back and it came again in well-done. guess they only serve well-done food but not quality and service. Without saying they never bothered to lit up the fire to warm up the customers even if we told them we were cold. I feel so sorry for taking my friends to this pricey joke! The only thing I can say is 'Think twice before you wanna step in this fancy(at least the price part) rooftop restaurant'.

title: Good views, very average food
comment: Managed a drink on the roof terrace in a break between showers. Nice ambience, herbs growing in pots and beds around. Roof terrace restaurant is glazed and has sliding windows to give an open airy feel. Waiting staff ( with the exception of the Maitre d' who looked miserable and bored) very attentive. Food however very bland. We shared a mixed shell fish starter. Mussels, prawns, oysters,clams and crab which was good value but, with the exception of the oysters, totally tasteless. Main course Yellowfin tuna was totally overwhelmed by trying to make it look seared - it was also lacking in flavour. Chicken skewers were overcooked, dry and tasteless. The sides were ok but the chips were very hard. In summary disappointing meal which did not live up to the surrounding. 3 courses with wine approx. £100 per head

title: Excellent place, ill-mannered staff
comment: It's shame that such a beautiful rooftop is ruined by a very ill-mannered staff. My friends and I couldn't stand the blond lady at the reception: cold, stuck-up, unhelpful. She did her best to complicate our bday party. Utterly unpleasant.

title: Great roof top bar
comment: We visited the bar on Sunday afternoon. We were greeted by friendly staff and said we were popping in for drinks only. We were seated without fuss and given a menu. We enjoyed a lovely bottle of rose wine. Very good. We would definitely return especially in the summer when we can sit outside.

title: Roof Top Terrace- Say no more
comment: Boundary is located in the heart of Shoreditch with all its colourful and quirky street art. Boundary is a great place to get away from the noise and the bonus? There is a roof top terrace. The atmosphere is great and the staff are very friendly. I would recommend booking a table in advance especially in summer. The drinks are amazing and so is the food. However, it is a bit pricey and there is not much to choose from the menu. I will defiantly return in the future

title: Good venue, disappointing service
comment: Had lunch in the rooftop restaurant, a great location though on this occasion very noisy thanks to a large, rowdy birthday party. Little the restaurant can do about that. Food and wine menu aren't extensive but a good selection. We ordered starters and main and waited and waited - service was very slow. For main we ordered a deluxe fruits de mer but only got the basic version (minus lobster) although we were charged for it until I complained. It's a shame because all the ingredients are there for a great experience. Unfortunately the execution is pretty ordinary. I hope they get the service right, then they might be onto something good

title: Great time on the roof top
comment: We went with 4 friends yesterday for dinner in this rooftop in Shoreditch and we all had a fantastic time.  Very efficient and friendly service, great atmosphere and music.  I had a very nice grilled rib eye and a very good strawberry tart.  I loved as well the super refreshing cocktails.  Highly recomended!!!

title: Amazing lunch on the terrace
comment: I had a great lunch on the Boundary rooftop with friends. The service was perfect thanks to Serena, a very nice and thoughtful waitress. The food is very good, we had the beautiful Mediterranean board to start, then seafood. Everything was excellent. Very nice ambiance with shiny happy people and a lot of rosé wine!

title: Good Time on the rooftop
comment: I had a Wonderful time in shoreditch with my girlfriend. The Place is warm and the view is just fantastic. The service was really nice thanks to Aurélie a lovely french waitress. Seafood and cocktails all good.

title: Gorgeous views from the rooftop bar
comment: This review is just for drinks at the rooftop bar. We didn't book, had to wait about 5/10 minutes and then we were up in the lift to the rooftop bar. They wait until seats / tables are available to let you up, I think this is a great idea as it's not absolutely rammed, it means everyone has a seat and can enjoy the view. Drinks are a little on the pricey side but table service was prompt and the whole experience was lovely so we didn't mind.

title: Flavourless and over priced.
comment: I don't mind paying ~£30 for a fondue or raclette, however they were both extremely plain. The fondue didn't have any flavour - no garlic, kirsh etc. The pickled onions were bland too! The venue and the service was good - good views across London.

title: Average food, great ambience!
comment: My friend and I came here for lunch, we really enjoyed the surroundings and even though we came on a rainy day the rooftop restaurant was still very airy and light. I will definitely be returning in the summer to make use of the outdoor seating area for drinks! Disappointed with the food...I ordered the chicken skewers and for the price we paid would expect good cuts of breast meat but instead we got chunks of brown meat with lots of gritty bits running through it... Such a shame as would expect a place like the boundary to use the best cuts of meat, very bland. I have heard the seafood platter is incredible so maybe stick to the fish if you do visit for food.  Service was good, we were served by two women both very friendly and welcoming! Will return in the futures for drinks on the rooftop but will definitely skip the food menu, plenty of better eateries in the area...

title: Nice but lacking in any atmosphere or soul
comment: Food was v nice but the venue lacks any real substance. Had a lunch with some associates and only us and 2 other tables In the restaurant. Waitress/hostess was dressed for the office rather than as a server of food. Had the chicken skewers and fries all v tasty but presentation was slightly bland - v beige. Would like to dine on a busy summers lunchtime and see if the ambience improves massively.

title: Pre Birthday dinner with friends
comment: What a great place, not to big, on the rooftop, quite intimate, excellent food. Red wine is a bit expensive but delicious.  I had the seafood sharing platter and the lobster, so yummy. Would definitely return for a special occasion!

title: Left underwhelmed
comment: I booked to have dinner to celebrate my birthday here and I have to say it was a disappointing experience. The set up on the rooftop is really lovely and atmospheric and I can imagine it looks great at night with all the lights - the view from the rooftop is not much at all - just other rooftops! Service was patchy - we were seated and then were waiting ages to be given menus - I had to request them in the end. The staff were friendly but appeared to be overstretched. The food itself was very average. I had the rib-eye steak - nothing to write home about - and there was only one sauce option given (bernaise) whereas I'm a fan of peppercorn. However my Dad ordered chicken skewers with tzatziki and spring onions which was very tasty. Once again the staff didn't notice when we had all finished our plates to clear them away, so I had literally had to call their attention again. When I made the booking I made them aware that I was celebrating my birthday but I have to say none of the staff made me feel special like other restaurants do. I would go back to this place purely for a more casual affair of drinks with friends or maybe brunch.

title: You're paying top price of the views
comment: There is no denying that the location and views from the rooftop are stunning. From different sides of the terrace you can see over london which is difficult to find in the centre. However having booked a table for dinner to celebrate my birthday I found the food overpriced and disappointing.  I ordered the Tuna steak, which was "ok" but only ok and for £18 for only the steak I was left underwhelmed. The biggest disappointment was for my poor vegetarian friends who were presented with 1 main meal option of just vegetables for £17!! all main dishes were only the main story with a small garnish. Potatoes/vegetables were an additional charge. The staff were polite, helpful and attentive. It's just such a shame the food is so overpriced and underwhelming.

title: Place worth the terrace drinks only
comment: Very poor service and low quality food. Food is overpriced.  Staff is extremely slow and inattentive.  There is an open kitchen and we were sitting next to it observing awful sanitary measures and chef touching with his fingers everything from his mouth and nose to laying out seafood on a plate. I would recommend this place for outside evening drinks on a terrace only.

title: Rooftop experience was good, service could have been a little better
comment: First time at the the boundary rooftop restaurant with some friends of ours in from Germany. Found it via an article of the best rooftop bars; think it rated about 5 or 6. We arrived at 12:30pm on a Sunday and it was very quiet until about 2pm when most tables were full. The service was okay and in reading some of the other reviews, this kind of aligns. We and appetisers, mains along with cocktails, beer and wine. All the food was very good. Nothing ultimately blew us away though. The location itself is nice at the top of the hotel. There is both an inside and an outside location. Given it is winter we were glad we went inside. Also helped it was a beautiful winter day with lots of sun. The only other thing to keep in mind is that the entrance is not on boundary street but around the corner.

title: Roof top
comment: Being in the area and craving for pudding, my friend and I decided to go up to the roof top for a little treat. It was a nice day and the setting was perfect. We ordered the ice cream and the tarte aux myrtilles to share. The ice cream (£6.50) consisted of 3 tiny little balls of below average quality. The tarte aux myrtilles (£7.5) was industrial and tasted of absolutely nothing. The texture was off. We complained to the waitress and sent them back. She offered us ONE chocolate mousse as a replacement saying that it was homemade. It came after a good 20min wait... it was ok, but I really didn't fancy a chocolate mousse and that had spoiled the whole magic.. To be fair, the manager came to speak to us and was apologetic. He took the desserts off the bill which was appreciated, but the service charge was still there.. I cannot understand how they can serve such disappointing desserts when they have the Albion downstairs!! I would go again on a nice day as the views are good, but just for cocktails.

title: What a lovely surprise
comment: On the edge of the City off shortdich high st. Boundary can be found. Via an unassuming door your greeted by a very welcoming hostess who helpfully told me to press "T" for top in the elevator. How lucky to have a joyful London Springtime sunny afternoon. The environment is just perfect. Unpretentious, simple yet comfortable furniture all with a relaxed style. The waiting personal friendly and very willing to offer suggestions and advise if sought. I ordered a glass of Savignon, my guest stayed with complimentary water. We both enjoyed early in season asparagus with a delicate hollandaise. I had the Mediterranean chicken kebabs on taziki with a garden salad. My guest selected the Fresh Tuna. Which was cooked perfectly "just as I wanted" exclaimed my guest.  We had some Mediterranean breads with oil etc on the table. In the sunshine we felt we could be abroad. Wonderful service by a waiter who ensured we never had a need to wait or ask He was just so effective and efficient.  I will definitely be returning to Boundary for another relaxed non-fussy meal.

title: Great ambience and staff but overpriced
comment: Excellent rooftop place, well maintained and decorated. Staffs are very helpful and jolly. Foods are overpriced for average quality.

title: Birthday meal at the terrace in Boundary restaurant
comment: Lovely restaurant with great food. Recomended highly for a evening family meal. Delicious food huge portion which is not common in London. Great ambience. I would give it a 5 star rating it's just they could not serve us any dessert. So was not very happy and hence 4 star. Certainly a great place to be.

title: Really nice moment
comment: We went there with some friends to have a drink on the rooftop. We were having such a nice time that we asked the waiters if it was possible to stay for dinner. Fortunately a table was available inside. The dinner was even better than the drinks. The veranda is cosy, the service was perfect. My fiancée and I are getting married in London this summer and planning to to celebrate the wedding there. Definitely one of the best rooftops in London.

title: Lunch on a roof top
comment: Fantastic view and great seafood platter for birthday lunch. Really cool building and friendly service too

title: Not bad....
comment: We visited the restaurant up top. Was a nice place with great surroundings. Food was good quality but wasn't sure it was worth the extortionate prices. There was nothing wrong with it but wasn't quite exquisite food. I would definitely visit again but probably mainly for drinks.

title: Lovely place with friendly staff
comment: Great atmosphere with lovely view. Staff is frienldy form hostess to managers and waiters. You can feel that peole working there enjoy their job. Lovely food for good value. Great place for dinner or lunch on sunny terrace. very well managed.

title: Rooftop is lovely, a shame about the terrible hotel reception staff
comment: We wanted to come for a late Sunday lunch - I checked on opentable and there were tables available so I didn't bother to book as we were only 10 minutes away. On arrival, the hotel reception staff told us there were no free tables on the roof. When I mentioned about the opentable availability they said I would have to talk to the restaurant downstairs about it. As I got out my phone to check that I hadn't made a mistake, another member of the hotel staff asked us to move out of the reception as it was for hotel guests. Long story short, there was a table free, we had a delicious lunch on the roof and the rooftop staff were charming. The grilled tuna was especially good. What a pity about the very rude hotel reception staff.

title: Less than average food, bad service, good wine
comment: Been there yesterday night at dinner on the rooftop - the view is great but I was expecting way more re food quality and service, considering pricing, location and status of the restaurant. The Mediterranean starter would better fit a whatever bar or veg cafe than a Restaurant. The fish platter was nothing but fair - you can find way better quality around. Out of the whole selection of seafood and fish I would only save the Tuna. Waiters and chefs were chatting and laughing all the time, definitely not the quality standard I was expecting. We also had a bottle of french wine which we appreciated a lot. I wouldn't suggest it as a place for dinner, wouldn't go again - if not for a quick cocktail on the terrace at sunset.

title: Classy restaurant with spectular roofterrace
comment: What I love most about the roof terrace is that it is quite small, which gives it a more familiar atmosphere than other roof terraces around.  There are inside tables on the top as well, so when it starts raining you can move inside. For food we had seafood, lamp chops and Languedoc white wine. Well recommended! Service was fantastic as well what I love about the roof terrace

title: Great Food / Vibrant Place
comment: Rooftop is absolutely Amazing ! My wife and I were delighted by the food, service and the place :) I would definitely recommend this restaurant

title: amazing rooftop in the middle of London
comment: I went there to celebrate NYE with my a couple of friends and we had a wonderful time there, we had dinner in the veranda on the rooftop, the food was delicious (we shared some oysters, I had the sea bream which was perfectly cooked and my friends had the lobster) and the staff very nice and cheerful, there was also a DJ for the night and the music was great, it's really unreal to have such a place in the middle of London! I haven't been yet but there is a deli shop downstairs and they apparently sell fresh and seasonal produces, my friend told me they make incredible scones. Definitely saved on my list.

title: Outstanding Dining Experience!
comment: A friend advised me this restaurant on the rooftop so I took friends to celebrate New Year's Eve. We spend one of our best New Year's Eve party ever. Great Dj, fabulous food, brilliant service and an unique experience for ourselves. We had an excellent lobster and we enjoyed the music and the very nice view. All in all, great food and super nice atmosphere, very Shoredicth!

title: Romantic rooftop bar
comment: it's really nice to be there, as if you are getting away from the crowds and busy streets of London and can enjoy the perfect view of the city, sip your drink and just chill out. Very romantic!And highly recommended

title: Relaxing roof top restaurant
comment: Sea food platter was fresh and absolutely delicious. They have friendly staff and some views of Shoreditch.

title: Great rooftop in Shoreditch!
comment: A great spot for lunch, drinks or hanging out with friends. All located in the heart of Shoreditch and privately tucked away.

title: Go to watch the sunset!
comment: Found the website after searching for rooftop bars in London. As you couldn't book a table in advance, I naively thought that we could just rock up and be seated, casually, so we arrived at 8pm to find a queue outside the door! We queued for about 45 minutes, but you know what? It was really worth it. We were just in time to see the sun set over Shoreditch, the views were excellent. The food was delicious. Half price off seafood on Sundays, so my OH got oysters and half a lobster for a very reasonable price!

title: Amazing rooftop un shoreditch
comment: We were at boundary's rooftop with couple of friends for the lunch ! It was amazing : the view, the service, and the food of course ! A very great experience in London in a wonderfull place ! I wish i will be lucky to test the hotel one day

title: Great view, perfect for a sunny day
comment: I had a really nice time serving lunch at the Boundary Rooftop Restaurant. The view is great and also having the sun on our side made the experience great. The food was good, and i can recommend the selection of cheeses. Also they have a variety of wines that you can choose from. I definitely recommend going there on a sunny day, i willbe a boost of energy and good vibe.

title: Poor service
comment: I came here for drinks on the rooftop and was left disappointed by the service to say the least. We had to ask twice to order drinks by a waiter who had a very carefree, blasé attitude towards us and seemed to be more interested in a group of loud, drunken ladies then serving others. Staff seemed to just be hanging around, laughing instead of serving. We then had to wait nearly 15 minutes for our drinks. Shame really as the actual rooftop area is lovely. And they seemed very eager for people to pay the bill!

title: Great place for drinks
comment: We went to the terrace of this place on a Sunday afternoon without any reservations and it was no fuzz at all to enter. There was a great cocktail list ambiance

title: very nice place!
comment: Very good and friendly service. Wonderfull view over London. The atmosphere is very class. Excellent to have a drink and enjoy London.

title: Service above and beyond and a lovely place
comment: We’d gone to London on a Sunday morning to the Columbia Road flower market. We were wandering back to meet some friends and had a couple of hours to spare. For no apparent reason we felt like oysters so I did a quick google and the nearest place that did them was the Boundary Terrace. Only snag was they didn’t open until 1230 for lunch and it was only just 11. We went anyway to see if there was any chance of getting served earlier and the absolutely lovely receptionist called up to the restaurant and asked if they’d be able to help.They agreed and we had a fantastic and very good value half dozen oysters and an excellent coffee, sitting on the gorgeous terrace with its big comfy sofas, plants, views across the city and really luxe cutlery and napkins. The service was brilliant and I’d heartily recommend Boundary to anyone. They certainly made our morning.

title: Very bad service
comment: Duty manger rudely made excuses roof was full after some rain, eventually allowed up to roof and it was empty! Table staff were very rude and arrogant and felt as though were doing us a favour, wiping the chairs off after rain. Spoilt whole experience as it was first visit as made to feel as if we were an inconvenience.

title: Great rooftop
comment: Yes it's slap bang in the middle of whoreditch and everyone has a trendy beard. But ignore that for a second and you'll find being on a rooftop in the sunshine in the centre of things is quite a nice place to be.

title: nothing special
comment: it is a nice rooftop in shore ditch , but if you not find a couch or a place near the balcony it's nothing really nice even the view is ok but nothing special as well , i had a few sharing drinks expensive and not even that nice. In general i think there are planty other choices in london than boundary

title: Buzzy with a nice atmosphere...but....
comment: Great place to meet up with friends and family in the heart of Shoreditch. Staff friendly and a great selection of food and drink to choose from...but.....Service was painfully slow. Not a place where you would go on a Saturday morning for a quick bite to eat then move on. Thank God the company was good! However, if a leisurely brunch is your type thing with time to kill - recommended

title: Superb!
comment: Great food, service & atmosphere. Expensive but the rooftop restaurant is fab. We spent an enjoyable afternoon in the sunshine celebrating 2 birthdays. Anything bad? Not really, the rose wine could have been a bit colder...

title: Pretentious and Unwelcoming
comment: I was meeting a friend for a drink and she suggested this bar as it was a glorious hot day and drinks in the sun sounded idyllic. I arrived first to secure a table and was told all tables were taken and if I wanted I could wait. I asked how long it was likely to be and was given a very sarcastic answer by the receptionist along the lines of I don't know how long it'll take people to drink their drinks. Not the best first impression but I thought ok I'm prepared to wait so went to sit down on the chairs next to the desk. I was immediately barked at that I couldn't sit there, they were only for guests of the hotel and I'd have to queue outside. The hotel reception was empty and it was boiling outside and I thought I might faint if I had to stand for any prolonged period of time. I therefore asked why I couldn't sit there when I may not be a guest of the hotel but I would be a guest of the establishment and if the hotel reception was busy I could see it might be an issue but it wasn't. I was given a response of 'you're not entitled to sit there' and made be feel like I wasn't good enough to be in the hotel reception. I've never been so unwelcome in an establishment. It's pretentious and just because it's the in place doesn't mean it gives people the right to be rude. I'd avoid at all costs. There are so many bars to choose from that are friendly and welcoming. Needless to say I won't be back.

title: Worst place to spend money
comment: Me and my friends found this place in here, and thought: Wow that is good ratings, lets try that.  We waited in line for a table in 2,5 hours. When we got up on the roof terrace they didn't ask whether or not we wanted food. We had to push them to give us a dinner table.  Dinner was horrible. The bruschetta starter was a joke (six dry pieces of bread with just a cut-in-half tomato on top - £10). The beef that come after was good, but NOT because of them. When ordering these £24 babies, they didn't even care to ask how we wanted them done. We asked for medium-rare. They came done. Fries and sauces was not good. The beef was tender (but this is out off there control). The view wasn't even good. Overall: Don't go here. There are so many great places in London don't waste your pounds and time.

title: A lovely afternoon!
comment: Came here on Saturday with my friend for some drinks and ended up staying 5 hours! It was such a lovely relaxing chilled atmosphere, not pretentious but still had a little more upmarket vibe (in a good way!). The staff were so friendly and polite and never once hassled us to order more drinks or food or made us feel like it was time to leave even though we had been there so long. We hadn't even booked a table and when we arrived there were only indoor ones available where we were sat but as soon as an outdoor one became available we were offered it and all our drinks etc were moved for us, considering we hadn't even booked a table i thought this was really great service! Its also nice that they don't just let people in when there are no tables available so you don't have people standing around your table and it doesn't feel crowded. This is a real gem in the heart of the city you would never know you are in London! Will definitely be returning.

title: Enjoyed ourselves in rooftop restaurant but quite average service. Must do better!
comment: I'll try to be brief. Came here with friends on 22 July for a belated birthday celebration. First of all we had to wait 50 minutes outside in a queue to get up to the terrace! Don't think I've queued this long for any building in New York (think about it)! And it was fairly early evening around 6.15. So when we did get to the roof-terrace we were shown to some seats which were fine but waited a good 10 minutes for anyone to even offer us a drink or drink list. Probably a reason why the wait to get in is so long! There are enough staff so they need to fix this. Having said that, we really did have a good time and decided while there to ask about a table on the actual same floor. Eventually I went to check for myself and spoke to a really nice lady (the manageress perhaps?) who actually asked a couple if they could move so that we (4) could sit together at a table. Great service from her. We moved and sat at the table for a further 10 minutes waiting for at least an offer of a menu or a wine list but nothing. Service is far too lax, I'm afraid. One of my friends had to ask for menus in the end, to which 1 of the waiters quickly presented them to us with a very sarcastic "Here are your menus" as if he was doing us a big favour. The waiter we then ended up with (a short guy with short black hair) was fine-but the kitchen was NOT! I ordered the chicken skewers which were fine but a little dry followed by tuna or swordfish (can't remember which now). The kitchen is open to the floor and we were sat 1 foot away from the main part of it, alongside it. They could see if we had finished or not. I had just eaten the last mouthful of chicken and lo and behold, here was the main course being served. A big mistake. Why on earth couldn't they check if we were all ready-we weren't and needed a breather between courses. The kitchen staff could see us very clearly.
