The fish was fine by the way, just the kitchen and service slap dash. As we left I said Goodnight to our waiter but he could hardly be bothered to reciprocate. I saw the lady who I think was the manager in the lift going down and I mentioned the service to her. I doubt if there'll be any improvement. A lovely evening because of my friends and the views but let down by the service and lack of attention.

title: Long wait, Awful service, waste of time!!!
comment: Waited an hour and a half to get up to the rooftop just for a drink, to be met with slow, inattentive waiters that got our order wrong. Then to wait 25mins just to pay the bill.  Good venue, but in no way worth the terrible service and extremely average cocktails. Don't waste your time!

title: So lovely - great rooftop bar that isn't pretentious
comment: Came with a friend for drinks and food in the sun on the rooftop. Had a lovely day - the staff couldn't do enough but weren't overbearing or hassling us to order or buy anything until we wanted to. Reasonably priced and nice food, the cocktail pitchers were lovely. Would highly recommend to anyone fancying a relaxed afternoon in Shoreditch.

title: Roof top lunch
comment: Nice setting on a sunny day. Lunch was nice, but I would pay the prices for the location and setting not for the food. Good service.

title: Steak and a view in the Sun
comment: I had the pleasure of a business lunch on the Boundary Rooftop Garden restaurant in Shoreditch, London on Monday with a good friend (his recommend). What a perfect little sanctuary for a perfect lunch. Roof top is accessed by a lift from ground floor. Seating is rustic and set amongst planters of grasses, ferns and exotic plans (I assume they are as I am not a plant specialist) which gave effect of little secluded areas. Included seating that was more lounger with cushions. I imagine very pretty at night with the lighting and open fires. Menu had great variety as did the wine list. Had the asparagus starter. the Chorizo and squid looked good to. Main was a rib eye steak, flame grilled to perfection and had a very peasant and distinctive taste. To much food for pud so cannot comment on suites. Breads offered were interesting and waiter explained their making, nice touch. Staff were attentive but not intrusive. In summary, a sunny place to have a pleasant lunch or dinner, have a view over the city and only be a short distance away from the office. Somewhere very different to bring your guests for corporate hospitality. Definitely book, don't turn up on spec - was busy. See you there next week ...........

title: Great roof top and great service!
comment: Really impressed with this place. Stayed from 1PM until 8PM with friends lolling on the roof it was just lovely. The service was great especially from Leo. Food also brill. I had the monkfish and my friend had the lamb.  The only and very small downside was not having my expresso martini in a proper martini glass but I am now sounding like a complete moron so all is forgiven.

title: Lovely View
comment: Service is a bit hit and miss (staff forgot our nibbles order), they had run out of 2 of the white wines (there are only 7 on the menu) and you have to queue to get in, but overall a nice place to have a drink on a sunny evening while looking out over London.

title: On a Sunny Day in London
comment: This is the place to have a drink at the end of the day. Up on the roof of this old building is a great bar with a good wine list. We drank champagne and ate yummy nibbles. Ny 6:30 this place was hopping and packed tight. It had a great vibe and if we had not had reservations elsewhere we would have spent the night. the staff were lovely and it was really fun. Best way to get to the roof is to go through the little hotel.

title: Great terrace setting and service
comment: I came here after work for a drink and food on a warm early evening. We had the house white and seafood platter with a couple of sides and all were excellent and reasonable (for London). The view is interesting and not overlooked, though you're not going to see any London landmarks from here. There is a hipster feel and it is full of Londoners as it always would be considering the location which adds to the great atmosphere. Overall, it felt very relaxed and how a terrace bar should be. Highly recommended.

title: Amazing place, average food
comment: Went to Boundary for the first time yesterday for lunch time, arrived at 11.45 am to queue for a good table as it was an amazingly sunny day.  The rooftop area is just amazing, it feels like you're somewhere in Barcelona not in London. The atmosphere is really chilled, with some good music going on in the background. Service was also quite nice and friendly. What disappointed us though was food and drinks. The jug of we ordered Pimms was more about style than substance...nothing really special about it. I ordered a spatchcok poussin which was probably 70% bones, a friend of mine ordered an artichoke which was full of ants, so we were overall not happy about the food.

title: Amazing experience at the rooftop terrace of the Boundary restaurant
comment: Beautiful Sunday and we looked forward to this promising rooftop terrace for a late lunch. We didn't make a reservation so we ended up in a queue and had to wait for over 30 minutes. But it was worth to wait. We enjoyed the cozy terrace with olive trees and nice seatings. We started with a fruit de mer platter for two, followed by a nice chicken skewers and a goat cheese salad. On the side we ordered a salade nicoise (without the tuna) and french fries. It was a great Sunday afternoon and we come definitely back next time.

title: Rooftop drinks with friends
comment: I would never have known about this place if it were not for my friends recommendation.  It was a hot sunny day and we wanted a roof terrace setting so chose here.  The first impression we got from the staff in the reception area was not good. We were spoken down to and told to wait outside. She eventually came out to us and said we can go up. We chose a sofa and table and ordered our first drinks.  The waiter didn't smile once and seemed like he didn't want to be there. We couldn't work out if it was supposed to be a pretentious atmosphere or they were just rude staff. Either way i will never go back here. We spent a tidy sum on drinks, but would have stayed longer and had dinner if we were made to feel more welcome.  I think Mary Portas needs to pay a Visit here.  The only reason I gave this place the rating I did was because of the setting and the view.  The service and the staff would get a very poor vote for sure.

title: Rooftop service dreadful
comment: We didn't stay in this hotel but went to the bar. The bar is not a good advert for the hotel. The man at the bar snapped at the young waitress when we arrived. She looked terrified. We then sat down and waited and waited. Drinks were brought with a very take it or leave it attitude. When we wanted more, we waited and waited. Same happened when we wanted the bill. The toilet was dirty and we were very glad to get out of the place. It was just a Monday afternoon too! Grim

title: 10° but no heaters because is Summer!
comment: I went there with friends for a drink in the outside area on a Saturday evening.  Once managed to get upstairs the place looked fantastic bit the weather was cold and windy, so we asked for one of the several heaters around the terrace to be tuned on, but the floor manager simply refused to do it. Than in the desperate effort to get some source of heat we tried asking the same to a waiter, who told us literally "we are not turning them because is Summer", at first I though it was a joke, but he could not be more serious. Finally we decide to order some hot tea to warm ourself up and the the waiter pushed us towards ordering some of the most expensive Hot Toddies ever seen. Finally after waiting for good half an hour for 2 blankets (to be shared between 5 people). We left after 15 minutes and will not go back ever again and won't recumbent to anyone.

title: Lovely place, really poor service
comment: Hopes were raised by the MI5 style hoops I had to jump through to book a table on the warmest day of the year so far. Hopes remained high on arrival downstairs where we were greeted by a maitre de, a smiling lady who was expecting us, and a Chef who seemed intent on overseing our entry into the lift. However, on arrival at the rooftop things went progressively downhill. It turns out that the bookable area is all undercover - so we walked past hundreds of people sunning themselves in the open air I had gone through hoops to secure before some bloke reluctantly waved us in the direction of a table which was hemmed in by glass walls (the all-weather area, just don;t use it in summer!). I turned round to appeal for a table "outside" but he was long gone. After 5 mins standing around i went in search of the allusive bloke - found a similarly attired one - but was told we couldn't move out to the prime seats. My cohort and I resignedly sat down and rested our arms upon the worlds stickiest table to select drinks. 10 minutes later, menu's and extremeties firmly glued to the table, we again had to wave down a suit to order drinks - he looked astounded at our impudence. Another suit came to take the order (one bottle of wine, one cocktail) and he demanded a credit card upfront - I pointed out that they had my card details as part of the MI5 induction process and then braced myself for a hessian sack over the head to complete my initiation. Ignoring the hiatus before the wine eventually arrived; a further 15 mins passed and the cocktail appeared to have been given to someone much more fortunate than my friend. We waved over the youngest suit and reminded him what it was. He eventually returned with two cocktails and presented blatantly the wrong one to my parched friend. Seriously - it's only one drink - and the clue was in the word "blueberry". A green cocktail is probably not the ticket? We didn't leave a tip - and this went against my groups drinking ettitquette almost as much as leaving after just one drink did. All in all, a potentially lovely venue let down miserably by some rude, some incompetent and, a few sweet but slightly dumb staff.

title: Excellent terrace setting
comment: Went here for my daughters wedding meal in the evening with 17 others . The setting was lovely...a roof terrace....well presented table etc. Food was very good.....and the service was excellent. A big thank you to the waiting staff for their attentive servics
